location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: We are hiring a Senior Data Scientist to join Masanâ€™s central Data team, working on large-scale data problems across retail, FMCG, supply chain, and consumer platforms. This role is designed for candidates with a strong algorithmic foundation and experience working with large-scale systems, who want to apply their expertise to real business problems with measurable impact. You will work on end-to-end machine learning solutions, from problem framing and model development to deployment and performance monitoring. While this is a full-stack data science role, you will collaborate closely with Data Engineers, ML Engineers, and Product teams rather than working independently on infrastructure. Key Responsibilities Translate complex business problems into data science and machine learning solutions Design, build, and optimize models such as: recommendation and ranking systems; forecasting and demand prediction models; segmentation and scoring models Work with large-scale datasets and distributed systems to support production use cases Participate in building and improving end-to-end ML pipelines (training, deployment, monitoring) Collaborate with engineering teams to ensure models are scalable, stable, and maintainable Analyze model performance, identify issues, and continuously improve results Communicate insights, trade-offs, and technical decisions clearly to stakeholders Requirements Must-have 4â€“7+ years of experience in Data Science, Machine Learning, or related fields Strong foundation in algorithms, data structures, and applied statistics Proven experience working with large-scale systems or high-volume data Hands-on experience building and deploying production ML models Strong Python skills and experience with ML frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn) Experience working with distributed data processing (Spark, PySpark, or similar) Ability to work effectively with engineers and product teams in complex systems Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to reason from first principles Comfortable working with ambiguity and evolving requirements Able to balance technical excellence with business impact Ownership mindset with strong collaboration skills Preferred Experience building recommendation systems, ranking, or personalization models Background from big tech, platform companies, or large-scale digital products Familiarity with ML deployment tools (MLflow, Docker, FastAPI, CI/CD pipelines) Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, or GCP) Key note: We understand that senior candidates often consider timing carefully. Start dates are flexible, and we are open to discussing transition plans.

company: ARSEN Kawaijuku Tech Vietnam Co., Ltd.
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: We are looking for senior-level candidates or individuals with over 5 years of professional experience. Our story In the days before the Internet, current educational models were built on the premise of equal educational opportunity. These educational models ensure that everyone receives the same education by efficiently implementing education and its operation, resulting in a systematic structure based on a systematic lesson plan. However, it is not the best system for those who do not adapt to the systematic structure, and this was true for both teachers and learners. We aim to realize the concept of â€œestablishing a system of educational opportunities rather than providing one-size-fits-all education.â€ Our Business in Vietnam Our shareholder â€“ KEI Advanced, Inc is a member of Kawaijuku Group â€“ one of the largest educational company groups in Japan. We have been setting up Vietnam branch as a technical research and development center for all our projects in mainly Japan. Our strategy is to build the Vietnam branch to become the primary technology center for developing and retaining core technology for our business. Our Vietnam branch will provide our algorithms to Japanese educational institutions. Recruitment reason To accelerate the development of proprietary Large Language Models (LLMs) for smart tutoring systems and automated educational content generation, we are expanding our technical team at ARSEN Kawaijuku Tech Vietnam Co., Ltd. This recruitment supports the strategic growth of AI-driven education solutions for both domestic and global markets. Location Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh Responsibilities Design, develop, and fine-tune LLMs tailored for educational applications. Integrate Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines using LangChain and other frameworks. Build and maintain backend systems using Python and SQL to support AI functionalities. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement smart tutor features such as adaptive questioning, feedback generation, and personalized learning paths. Ensure scalability, performance, and security of AI services in production environments. Contribute to the continuous improvement of model accuracy and user experience through data analysis and experimentation. Specific requirements Proven experience in developing or fine-tuning LLMs (e.g., using Hugging Face, OpenAI, or similar frameworks). Hands-on experience with LangChain, RAG architecture, and vector databases (e.g., FAISS, Milvus). Proficiency in Python and SQL for data processing and backend development. Familiarity with cloud-based model deployment and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). Ability to read and write technical documentation in English. Preferable qualifications Experience in educational technology or e-learning platforms. Knowledge of Japanese language or experience working with Japanese clients. Understanding of Memory-Context-Prompt (MCP) design patterns in conversational AI. Experience with MLOps tools and CI/CD pipelines. Master's degree or higher in Computer Science, AI, or related fields. Company benefits Annual health check. Hybrid work: up to two days of remote work per week. 13th month salary bonus and performance bonus (if any). Support for gasoline (800,000 VND/month). Happy hour party every Friday (1 hour), year-end party, and other events. Wedding gifts and mid-autumn gifts on various occasions. Support for costs of participating in online classes (work-related).

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Company Description KMS Technology is a strategic engineering company helping businesses turn bold ideas into high-impact solutions - faster. Founded in 2009 as a U.S.-based services company, weâ€™ve grown into a global organization with locations in the US, Vietnam, and Mexico. KMS is trusted globally for the quality of our engineering and consulting services. We bring deep expertise in product development and quality assurance, AI-native engineering, and delivery excellence to every engagement. Our mission is to help customers build whatâ€™s nextâ€”accelerating innovation, crafting brilliant solutions, and creating real-world impact. At KMS, we believe sustainable growth is built on the success of our clients and employees and in making a lasting contribution to our communities within 3 main business sectors: Enterprise software development services: Leverage software domain expertise to help clients make better business decisions in technology platforms, increase speed-to-market, and gain critical development support through innovative technology solutions Healthcare technology solutions: Build transformative next-gen technologies to solve healthcareâ€™s most challenging problems, providing innovative tools and expertise to providers, payers, life sciences, and medical technology vendors Banking, Financial Services & Insurance (BFSI) technology solutions: Empower BFSI businesses to embrace the digital finance revolution and expedite clientsâ€™ journey towards complete digitalization, technology consulting, data analytics, software development, and software quality Job Description Requirements Elicitation: Lead individual and group meetings to gather detailed business requirements. Perform Impact Analysis: Identify and analyze scope change. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for business process improvement and make recommendations. Present user requirements, functional specifications, technical specifications, and process flow diagrams to the development team. System Specifications: Develop system specifications and work closely with development teams to ensure alignment with business needs. Data Modeling: Create data models and process diagrams to represent business needs. Stakeholder Management: Facilitate requirements meetings and workshops with stakeholders. Solution Evaluation: Assist in evaluating potential solutions to meet business requirements through independent investigation. Adhere to product best practices to ensure consistent technical solution design. Collaboration: Facilitate discussions with business stakeholders, developers, and QA teams to ensure requirements are clearly understood, technical solutions are aligned, and testing plans are robust. Act as a key point of contact for complex system-related issues, providing detailed analysis and insights to refine design approaches. All other tasks as assigned. Qualifications At least more than 1 year of experience in business analysis Possess IT background Intermediate Business Analysis and Configuration Tools: Proficiency in more advanced tools and software for requirements management and documentation (e.g., Jira, Excel, Word, Microsoft Visio, PowerPoint). Undertake medium complexity configuration activities (RMT/Workbenches). Intermediate Data Analysis: Ability to conduct more detailed data analysis and create complex reports using data analysis tools or databases (e.g., SQL). Understanding of SDLC Methodologies: Deeper understanding of SDLC methodologies and the ability to apply them in various project contexts. Documentation Skills: Ability to create detailed business requirement documents and functional specifications. Business Process Modeling: More advanced understanding of business process modeling techniques. Business Analysis Techniques: Proficient in various business analysis techniques such as SWOT analysis, GAP analysis, and root cause analysis. Additional Information Perks You'll Enjoy Working in one of the Best Places to Work in Vietnam Building large-scale & global software products Working & growing with Passionate & Talented Team Diverse careers opportunities with Software Services, Software Product Development, IT Solutions & Consulting Attractive Salary and Benefits Performance appraisals every year and performance bonus Onsite opportunities: short-term and long-term assignments in North American (U.S, Canada), Europe, Asia. Flexible working time Various training on hot-trend technologies, best practices and soft skills Premium healthcare insurance for you and your loved ones Company trip, big annual year-end party every year, team building, etc. Fitness & sport activities: football, tennis, table-tennis, badminton, yoga, swimmingâ€¦ Joining community development activities: 1% Pledge, charity every quarter, blood donation, public seminars, career orientation talks,â€¦ Free in-house entertainment facilities (foosball, ping pong, gymâ€¦), coffee, and snack (instant noodles, cookies, candiesâ€¦) And much more, join us and let yourself explore other fantastic things!

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Department: Client Experience Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time Location: Ho Chi Minh City Reporting To: Quan Phi Description Location - Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam Hybrid working - Office based 1 day per week Hours - 2pm-11pm including 1 hour break Why Confluence? At Confluence, weâ€™ve always been driven by a commitment to innovation, precision, and partnership in the investment data space. Our global footprint now spans multiple countries, giving our employees the opportunity to get exposure to other countries and cultures. And it stands to reason that none of this would have been possible without the hundreds of hard-working employees who work at Confluence. More about the role & team ðŸ§© About the Role Weâ€™re building a new global managed services team focused on two integrated compliance products: AccuDelta , a powerful data validation and extraction tool, and Maia , a document generation platform for regulatory content like PRIPs, UCITS, and SFDRs. As a Client Consultant , youâ€™ll play a crucial role in supporting our clients across regulatory data and document production workflows. ðŸ‘¥ Key Responsibilities Manage incoming client data, ensuring quality and compliance using internal tools Handle inquiries via Zendesk ticketing system with professionalism and accuracy Collaborate with team members across Ireland, Spain, Tunisia, Paris, and Vietnam Perform daily/monthly operational tasks to meet service level standards Occasionally join client calls to discuss ticket updates or review data workflows ðŸ’¡ Why Join Us? Become part of a collaborative and global team working at the intersection of data and compliance Opportunity to contribute to the integration of cutting-edge platforms Structured onboarding, tools training, and ongoing mentorship What skills and experience do I need to succeed? ðŸŽ¯ Essential Skills Proficiency in Excel and readiness to learn new tools like AccuDelta and Maia Strong communication skills, both written and verbal (email + occasional phone) Experience in client support or operations within a compliance or tech-related field Ability to manage multiple tasks, troubleshoot issues, and meet deadlines ðŸ—£ Language Requirements English: Required - Excellent written skills French: Fluent essential What do we offer? Benefits Confluence offers generous benefit packages for team members. As a growing, global organization, we are always looking for ways to ensure that our employees can access benefits that matter to them and their families. This includes: ðŸ•š Generous Time Off packages including additional half days with each public holiday in your location. ðŸŒŽ Global Career Development opportunities ðŸŽŠ Social Events ðŸ’µ Referral Bonus scheme - Upto $3,000 per successful referral ðŸš€ Plus many more! More about the Location We offer flexible working options for all employees. Values We look for people who align with our 4 values. Integrity Face reality with honesty, courage and accountability Imagination Deal creatively with challenges and envision what the world could be Discipline Build good habits into reflexes which become a part of our life Service Committed to the success of others If you would like to find out more about a Career at Confluence, please apply today.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About the Role: As a Tech Lead , you will play a crucial role in overseeing the development of our cutting-edge. You will guide and mentor a team of talented engineers, ensuring adherence to best practices and fostering a culture of continuous improvement. You will also collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product management, design, and QA, to deliver high-quality solutions that meet our business objectives. If you have a strong technical background in both front-end and back-end development, with the ability to architect solutions, provide technical guidance, and lead a team of developers, you are an ideal candidate for this position. Responsibilities: â— Technical Leadership: Provide technical guidance and mentorship to a team of software engineers, fostering their growth and development. Conduct code reviews, oer constructive feedback, and champion best practices in software development. â— Project Oversight: Oversee the entire software development lifecycle, from design and implementation to testing and deployment. Ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. â— Architecture Design: Contribute to the design and evolution of our software architecture, ensuring scalability, maintainability, and performance. â— Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate effectively with product managers, designers, QA engineers, and other stakeholders to gather requirements, define specifications, and deliver seamless user experiences. â— Best Practices & Process Improvement: Promote and implement best practices in software development, including coding standards, testing methodologies, and CI/CD pipelines. Identify areas for process improvement and drive initiatives to enhance team efficiency. â— Problem Solving: Troubleshoot complex technical issues, provide effective solutions, and proactively identify and mitigate potential risks. â— Performance Management: Contribute to performance reviews and provide regular feedback to team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement. â— Full-Stack Development: Actively participate in the development process, contributing to both front-end and back-end tasks as needed. â— Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate       and streamline the development and deployment processes. â— Leadership: Manage and inspire a team of developers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. Requirements: â— Technical Expertise at: â—‹ Front-End Development: Proven proficiency in HTML, CSS, PHP, JavaScript, modern JavaScript frameworks (React/Vue), and UX/UI design principles. â—‹ Back-End Development: Strong experience with Java, Nodejs, REST API development, and database technologies (e.g., SQL, NoSQL). â—‹ Full-Stack Experience: Demonstrated ability to work across the full technology stack, contributing to both front-end and back-end development. â— Architecture Design: Experience designing and implementing scalable and maintainable software architectures. â— CI/CD: Familiarity with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment practices and tools. â— Experience 8+ years of experience, in which minimum 2 years of experience leading and mentoring a development team. â— Proven ability to motivate and inspire team members to achieve common goals. â— Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical challenges. To apply for the job, please send your updated CV to: Email: hang.nguyen@matchupfast.com or contact via phone number/zalo 0965280462

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: The Job in short As a Senior Data Engineer , you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the data platform for the Backbase Data as a Service (DaaS) Platform. Your experience and expertise in data engineering will ensure the success of the DaaS platform. The Data as a Service platform enables Backbase and their customers to perform big data analytics on data stored in the Engagement Banking Platform. You are expected to develop, maintain and test data infrastructure for retrieving data from many different data sources into a Data Lakehouse to enable data scientists and analyst to do their jobs. The Backbase Data Team is responsible for extracting data stored from the different systems in use in Backbase to unlock new insights and products built on top of the data platform. At Backbase we aim to deliver a turn-key Data as a Service platform built on top of the state Azure technology. The DaaS platform will enable customers from Backbase to run analytical, AI and ML workloads on data stored in the Engagement Banking Platform without affecting the operational state of the systems. You will develop and maintain the data pipelines for extracting data from many different sources, such as RDBMS, Change Data Capture and streaming endpoints. Captured data ranges from observability metrics to bank accounts and transactions that need to be processed in a highly secure and compliant manner. You guard the data consistency, quality and end to end governance from where data is born to where it is used in dashboards, AI / ML applications and other data consumers. Meet the job The Backbase Data Team is responsible for extracting data stored from the different systems in use in Backbase to unlock new insights and products built on top of the data platform. At Backbase we aim to deliver a turn-key Data as a Service platform built on top of the state Azure technology. The DaaS platform will enable customers from Backbase to run analytical, AI and ML workloads on data stored in the Engagement Banking Platform without affecting the operational state of the systems. You will develop and maintain the data pipelines for extracting data from many different sources, such as RDBMS, Change Data Capture and streaming endpoints. Captured data ranges from observability metrics to bank accounts and transactions that need to be processed in a highly secure and compliant manner. You guard the data consistency, quality and end to end governance from where data is born to where it is used in dashboards, AI / ML applications and other data consumers. How about you â— A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field; â— 5+ years of experience in data engineering, preferably in Azure Synapse, Spark, or Data Bricks; â— Expertise in Data Lakehouse concepts and Delta Lake; â— Deep understanding of data domains, regulations, and compliance requirements; â— Strong leadership and project management skills; â— Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Department: Client Experience Location: Vietnam Description Vietnam - HCMC- HYBRID Why Confluence? At Confluence, weâ€™ve always been driven by a commitment to innovation, precision, and partnership in the investment data space. Our global footprint now spans multiple countries, giving our employees the opportunity to get exposure to other countries and cultures. And it stands to reason that none of this would have been possible without the hundreds of hard-working employees who work at Confluence. More about the role & team ðŸŒŸ Be the Bridge Between Innovation and Client Success! ðŸŒŸ As an Associate Data Operations Analyst, youâ€™ll launch your career by applying best practices and learning from experienced colleagues. With support and guidance, youâ€™ll confidently execute tasks and transform data into actionable insights and recommendations. Youâ€™ll play a vital role in supporting both your team and our clients, while gradually stepping up to lead small-scale projects and initiatives. This is your chance to grow, contribute, and make an impact in a collaborative, global environment! ðŸš€ðŸ’¡ðŸ¤ What Youâ€™ll Do ðŸ› ï¸ ðŸ¤ Support the team and clients by executing data operations tasks with guidance from senior colleagues. ðŸ’¡ Create basic insights and recommendations in your area of expertise. ðŸ–¥ï¸ Update, maintain, and process market data using proprietary company software. ðŸ§¹ Assist in sourcing, cleansing, and verifying data according to defined guidelines. ðŸ“ˆ Analyze data and investigate queries from business and clients. ðŸ“Š Prepare data and reports for key stakeholders. ðŸŒ Collaborate on projects with global colleagues. ðŸ“ Suggest process improvements and escalate product enhancements. â° Monitor data traffic and schedules, escalating issues as needed. ðŸ—‚ï¸ Participate in regulatory reporting and data validation tasks. Working Time- Monday - Friday: 2pm - 11pm ICT If youâ€™re ready to grow your skills, make an impact, and help clients achieve their goals, this is the perfect opportunity to launch your consulting career! ðŸš€ What skills and experience do I need to succeed? What Youâ€™ll Bring ðŸ§‘â€ðŸ’» ðŸŽ“ Bachelorâ€™s degree in a technical field. ðŸ“… 2+ years of experience in technical/data analysis; financial services or data governance experience preferred. ðŸ… Certifications in SQL, scripting, or related areas. ðŸ› ï¸ Proficiency with Confluence products and current technologies (Oracle/SQL Server, Tableau, Mapforce, etc.). ðŸ” Strong technical configuration skills and attention to detail. ðŸ—£ï¸ Excellent communication, organizational, and presentation skills. ðŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Ability to multitask, self-motivate, and take initiative. ðŸŒ Passion for diversity and diplomacy in a global environment. ðŸ’» Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint). ðŸŒŸ Commitment to our company values: Integrity, Imagination, Discipline, and Service. French Speaking is ESSENTIAL. ðŸŒˆ Why Join Us? Be part of a collaborative, innovative team Grow your skills in the fast-paced FinTech industry Make a difference for clients and the business Ready to kickstart your consulting career? Apply now and help us deliver outstanding solutions for our clients! âœ¨ What do we offer? Confluence offers generous benefit packages for team members. As a growing, global organization, we are always looking for ways to ensure that our employees can access benefits that matter to them and their families. This includes: ðŸ•š Generous Time Off packages including additional half days with each public holiday in your location. ðŸŒŽ Global Career Development opportunities ðŸŽŠ Social Events ðŸ’µ Referral Bonus scheme - Upto $3,000 per successful referral ðŸš€ Plus many more! More about the Location We offer flexible working options for all employees. Values We look for people who align with our 4 values. Integrity Face reality with honesty, courage and accountability Imagination Deal creatively with challenges and envision what the world could be Discipline Build good habits into reflexes which become a part of our life Service Committed to the success of others If you would like to find out more about a Career at Confluence, please apply today. Pre-Employment Screening Disclaimer As part of our recruitment process, we carry out identity checks on all candidates. Offers of employment are conditional upon the completion of satisfactory background checks prior to the commencement of work. These checks may include verification of identity, right to work in the UK, employment history, and other relevant pre-employment screening. Please note that additional checks may be required depending on the nature of the role and the jurisdiction in which the role is based or operates. These may include, but are not limited to, criminal record checks or financial background checks where applicable.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Cake â€“ a leading Vietnamese digital bank with over 6 million users â€“ is building the NextGen AI Bank , where data and AI are at the core of every product and decision. We are looking for Data Analysts who want to grow into Data Scientists , working on real, large-scale business problems in digital banking. In this role, you will gradually transition from descriptive & diagnostic analytics into predictive modeling, machine learning, and decision intelligence , especially in Recommendation Systems, Credit Scoring, and Customer Analytics . What You Will Do 1. Grow from Analytics to Data Science Start from deep business understanding and data exploration , then evolve into building predictive and machine learning models. Analyze large-scale datasets to identify patterns, customer behavior, risk signals, and business opportunities. Design and implement statistical models and machine learning solutions with guidance from senior DS/AI leaders. 2. Solve Real Business Problems with Data Work closely with Product, Business, and Risk teams to: Translate business questions into analytical and modeling problems. Turn insights into data-driven recommendations for product, growth, and risk decisions. Apply data science across areas such as: Customer acquisition & engagement Credit & risk analytics Product optimization and personalization 3. Model Development & Improvement Build, evaluate, and improve: Predictive models Segmentation and scoring models Early-stage ML pipelines Monitor model performance, data quality, and business impact. Ensure models are interpretable and explainable for non-technical stakeholders. 4. Collaborate & Learn Work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers, and ML Engineers in production-grade systems. Learn best practices in: Feature engineering Model validation Bias & performance monitoring Actively participate in knowledge sharing and continuous improvement within the team. What Weâ€™re Looking For Background & Experience Bachelorâ€™s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics , or related fields. 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst / Analytics role , preferably in fintech, banking, e-commerce, or tech-driven companies. Strong analytical mindset with a clear intention to transition into Data Science . Technical Skills (Must-have) Strong SQL and data analysis skills. Proficiency in Python for data analysis (pandas, numpy, matplotlib/seaborn). Solid foundation in: Statistics & probability Hypothesis testing Regression and classification concepts Experience working with large datasets and dashboards/reports. Data Science Readiness (Nice-to-have / Will Be Trained Further) Hands-on exposure to machine learning (even at basic level): scikit-learn or similar libraries Predictive modeling or scoring projects Familiarity with model evaluation concepts (AUC, precision/recall, RMSE, etc.). Experience with big data tools or cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) is a plus. Business & Mindset Strong curiosity and problem-solving mindset. Ability to communicate insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders. Passion for using data to drive real-world business impact. Willingness to learn, experiment, and grow into a full Data Scientist role. What Youâ€™ll Get at Cake Competitive compensation with 13th-month salary & performance bonus (up to 4 months) . MacBook provided for all technical roles. BE Corp benefits budget for transportation, food, and booking services. Full social insurance based on your level. Annual health check & premium PTI healthcare after probation. 15 days annual leave . Company trips, team-building, and regular happy hours. A clear career path from Data Analyst â†’ Data Scientist â†’ Senior DS / AI roles in a real AI-first bank.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Job Description Manage KPIs and incentive frameworks / tracking to monitor BD performance. Collaborate with PMO, BD, CP, Fin teams to standardize SOPs for tracking out of system data (Ads, non system investment, welcome package payment...) Develop and manage reporting dashboards to support BD teams in performance tracking Conduct BD team productivity and performance reviews; provide actionable insights to BD leadership. Deliver data analysis and support for decision-making. Requirements 1â€“2 years of experience in Data Analysis, Business Analysis, or Business Intelligence. Hands-on experience with SQL and data crawling tools. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Sheets. Experience in food delivery or e-commerce industries preferred. Strong project management and communication skills. Data-driven mindset with the ability to translate insights into actions. Ability to perform well under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Responsible, collaborative team player with a growth mindset.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About TymeX TymeX is Tyme Group 's Technology & Product Development Hub with a global mission to become serial bank builders. Our Financial Crime platform plays a critical role in protecting customers and the bank from fraud, money laundering, and other financial crimes using advanced data, AI, and automation. About The Role We are looking for a highly skilled Data Integration Engineer to join our Financial Crime Platform team. In this role, you'll design and maintain data integrations across a variety of systems â€” from internal banking platforms to external compliance, biometric, and risk data providers. You will work closely with Data Engineers, Product Owners, and Compliance teams to ensure the seamless flow of data that supports profiling, entity resolution, and case management for FinCrime investigations. Key Responsibilities Design, implement, and maintain data integration pipelines between TymeX's FinCrime platform and external systems (e.g. Authentication, ID, sanctions, behavioural, device and other third party platforms) Build and optimize data ingestion and transformation processes using Python and PySpark, Declarative Pipelines, Streaming technologies. Synchronous Real Time Data Ingestion - optimization and performance benchmarking Work with APIs, message queues, and data streaming frameworks to ensure smooth data exchange between systems. Collaborate with product and operations/compliance teams to define integration requirements and data mapping logic. Ensure integrations meet security, reliability, and scalability standards. Support troubleshooting and performance tuning for data flows and services. Maintain integration documentation and version control. Requirements Must-Have: 3+ years of experience as an Integration Engineer, Data Engineer, or Backend Developer. Strong programming skills in Python and experience with PySpark, Scala and/or SQL. Proven experience with API integrations (REST, JSON, OAuth). Solid understanding of ETL / ELT processes and data pipelines. Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred). Strong SQL skills and familiarity with Databricks or Snowflake. Good English communication skills â€” able to work in cross-functional and international teams. Nice to Have: Familiarity with tools such as integration patterns best practices. Experience in Financial Crime / Fraud, KYC systems or compliance domains. Understanding of data orchestration frameworks. Exposure to data streaming (Kafka, Spark Streaming) or real-time risk detection systems. Benefits Be part of a mission-driven company tackling financial crime with technology and data. Work with a modern data stack. International exposure â€” collaborate with teams across Vietnam, Philippines, Singapore, and South Africa. Hybrid working model and flexible environment. Competitive salary, performance bonuses, and professional growth opportunities.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Our Company BioTuring is an innovative bioinformatics company that develops algorithms, and agentic AI software to serve scientists from hundreds of pharmaceutical companies and leading research institutions, enabling discoveries about human diseases. Role Description Weâ€™re seeking a highly motivated Product Specialist to join our growing team at BioTuring. You will serve as a critical bridge between users, product teams, and other departmentsâ€”helping to ensure that our solutions deliver maximum value to researchers and scientists around the world. Key Responsibilities Develop a deep understanding of the productâ€™s capabilities, workflows, and value proposition. Serve as the internal and external subject matter expert on product functionality and user experience, with a focus on bioinformatics, statistics, and data analytics domains. Lead product demonstrations, training, and user onboarding sessions for new and existing clients. Gather comprehensive user feedback and translate findings into actionable, prioritized insights for the Product and Engineering teams. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams (e.g., product, engineer and commercial) to support product launches, documentation, and continuous improvement. Create well-structured and detailed technical documentation for internal teams and end-users. Lead quality assurance (QA) activities, including issue tracking and feature validation, throughout the product development and update lifecycle. Contribute to the development of the product roadmap based on user needs, market trends, and technical feasibility. Stay up-to-date on bioinformatics and statistical advancements. Requirements Bachelor's, Master's or PhD degree in Biology, Data Analyst, Data Science, Statistical Analyst, Business management or related fields. Strong organizational and communication skills to manage multiple user relationships and internal collaborations. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Ability to lead in-person and online training sessions We Offer Competitive salary and benefits package. A collaborative and supportive work environment. A chance to learn and grow your career in a rapidly evolving field.

location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
job_description: Location: HCM or Hanoi Working place: Hybrid Sign-on Bonus : Eligible for candidates who are currently employed elsewhere and able to join GFT within 30 days of offer acceptance. What do we do? GFT Technologies is driving the digital transformation of the worldâ€™s leading financial institutions. Other sectors, such as industry and insurance, also leverage GFTâ€™s strong consulting and implementation skills across all aspects of pioneering technologies, such as cloud engineering, artificial intelligence, the Internet of Things for Industry 4.0, and blockchain. With its in-depth technological expertise, strong partnerships and scalable IT solutions, GFT increases productivity in software development. This provides clients with faster access to new IT applications and innovative business models, while also reducing risk. Weâ€™ve been a pioneer of near-shore delivery since 2001 and now offer an international team spanning 16 countries with a global workforce of over 9,000 people around the world. GFT is recognised by industry analysts, such as Everest Group, as a leader amongst the global mid-sized Service Integrators and ranked in the Top 20 leading global Service Integrators in many of the exponential technologies such as Open Banking, Blockchain, Digital Banking, and Apps Services. Role Summary As a Lead/Senior Data Engineer at GFT, you will be responsible for managing, designing, and enhancing data systems and workflows that drive key business decisions. The role is focused 75% on data engineering, involving the construction and optimization of data pipelines and architectures, and 25% on supporting data science initiatives through collaboration with data science teams for machine learning workflows and advanced analytics. You will leverage technologies like Python, Airflow, Kubernetes, and AWS to deliver high-quality data solutions. Key Activities Architect, develop, and maintain scalable data infrastructure, including data lakes, pipelines, and metadata repositories, ensuring the timely and accurate delivery of data to stakeholders Work closely with data scientists to build and support data models, integrate data sources, and support machine learning workflows and experimentation environments Develop and optimize large-scale, batch, and real-time data processing systems to enhance operational efficiency and meet business objectives Leverage Python, Apache Airflow, and AWS services to automate data workflows and processes, ensuring efficient scheduling and monitoring Utilize AWS services such as S3, Glue, EC2, and Lambda to manage data storage and compute resources, ensuring high performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency Implement robust testing and validation procedures to ensure the reliability, accuracy, and security of data processing workflows Stay informed of industry best practices and emerging technologies in both data engineering and data science to propose optimizations and innovative solutions Required Skills Core Expertise: Proficiency in Python for data processing and scripting (pandas, pyspark), workflow automation (Apache Airflow), and experience with AWS services (Glue, S3, EC2, Lambda) Containerization & Orchestration: Experience working with Kubernetes and Docker for managing containerized environments in the cloud Data Engineering Tools: Hands-on experience with columnar and big data databases (Athena, Redshift, Vertica, Hive/Hadoop), along with version control systems like Git Cloud Services: Strong familiarity with AWS services for cloud-based data processing and management CI/CD Pipeline: Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, CircleCI, or AWS CodePipeline for continuous integration and deployment Data Engineering Focus (75%): Expertise in building and managing robust data architectures and pipelines for large-scale data operations Data Science Support (25%): Ability to support data science workflows, including collaboration on data preparation, feature engineering, and enabling experimentation environments Nice-to-have requirements Advanced Data Science Tools: Experience with AWS Sagemaker or Databricks for enabling machine learning environments Big Data & Analytics: Familiarity with both RDBMS (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (DynamoDB, Redis) databases BI Tools: Experience with enterprise BI tools like Tableau, Looker, or PowerBI Messaging & Event Streaming: Familiarity with distributed messaging systems like Kafka or RabbitMQ for event streaming Monitoring & Logging: Experience with monitoring and log management tools such as the ELK stack or Datadog Data Privacy and Security: Knowledge of best practices for ensuring data privacy and security, particularly in large data infrastructures What can we offer you? Competitive salary 13th-month salary guarantee Performance bonus Professional English course for employees Premium health insurance Extensive annual leave Due to the high volume of applications we receive, we are unable to respond to every candidate individually. If you have not received a response from GFT regarding your application within 10 workdays, please consider that we have decided to proceed with other candidates.

job_title: Tech Lead / Senior Data Engineer (Azure/Databricks) - Freelance/Contract
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About the Role We are looking for an experienced Lead / Data Engineering Architect to design, build, and scale modern data platforms on Microsoft Azure . This role is ideal for someone who has deep expertise in Azure Databricks , Azure Data Factory , and other Azure data servicesâ€”and who enjoys both hands-on development and architectural leadership. Key Responsibilities Data Architecture & Design Design scalable, secure, and high-performance data architectures on Azure. Define data ingestion, transformation, modelling, and orchestration frameworks. Ensure solutions follow best practices for data governance, quality, lineage, metadata, and CI/CD. Hands-On Engineering Build and optimize data pipelines using Azure Databricks (PySpark), Azure Data Factory , Delta Lake , and Azure Storage (ADLS Gen2). Develop reusable data frameworks, ETL/ELT components, and automation scripts. Optimize Spark jobs, cluster configuration, and cost. Stakeholder Management Translate business goals into technical designs. Present architecture recommendations, roadmaps, and implementation plans to senior stakeholders. Required Skills & Experience 5+ years of data engineering experience; Strong hands-on experience with: Azure Databricks (PySpark, Delta Lake) Azure Data Factory Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS) Azure SQL / Synapse Azure Functions, Azure DevOps CI/CD Proven track record designing and implementing large-scale data pipelines (batch & streaming). Strong understanding of data modelling, distributed computing, and cloud-native architecture. Experience with Git, CI/CD, Terraform/Bicep is a plus. Experience in building Lakehouse architecture preferred

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Job Functions Data Analysis & Reporting: Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to produce key business insights. Design and deliver actionable reports and dashboards in reporting platforms. Ad-Hoc Analysis: Provide on-demand analysis to address specific business queries and support initiatives. Business Insights & Strategy: Collaborate with business leaders to deliver business insights to support decision-making across various departments, shaping strategy and creating understanding. Data Visualization & Dashboards: Develop dynamic, visually compelling dashboards that allow teams to monitor key metrics, track performance, and identify opportunities for improvement. Data Modeling: Use historical data to create predictive models and correlation outcomes, helping to plan for KPI performance and make proactive decisions. location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Company Introduction Our mission is to enable every organization to be climate conscious and positive with the worldâ€™s best climate software and data products. Persefoni is creating an all-in-one platform that allows organizations to measure, analyze, and reduce their Enterprise Carbon Footprint. Our goal is to provide our customers unprecedented visibility and insights into the impact their organization has on the environment. Leveraging the latest breakthroughs in data science and software, our technology will empower teams and leaders to mobilize their organizations to continuously improve their greenhouse gas emissions metrics. About The Role (What You Will Get To Do) The Data Engineer will be a key member to assist in building out our web services and backend persistence layer. Successful candidates should have a minimum of three years of recent professional programming in positions requiring the skills listed below with an emphasis on data integrity and data pipelines. Our project entails implementing our pre-approved development targets and developing a robust and reusable code framework to deliver a variety of new features across our product lines according to our preferred architecture design and best practices. Our backend stack is a combination of Golang, Redis, MySQL, and Snowflake while following the Clean Architecture Design pattern. APIs are documented and managed using the Open API framework and maintained in ReadMe. Our data pipelines for data loading and machine learning pipelines are managed via Databricks while our data transformation occurs with DBT against Snowflake within AWS cloud services. All development work is managed via JIRA tracked sprints, Github Git-flow branch management, and infrastructure is managed in AWS with monitoring in Datadog. Responsibilities (What We Expect) Collaborate on the design of data models, technical architecture, data flows, schemas, and API contracts. Relay updates on existing work via Jira ticket status, push well documented pull requests for features, and collaborate through review and comments on your fellow developer pull requests. Building scalable and robust data flows using Databricks, DBT and Snowflake. Add/Update to our backend persistence model in MySQL by writing SQL based migration scripts. Write/Update data test using native DBT tests and frameworks like Great Expectations to ensure adequate test coverage of our code base. Qualifications (What You Bring To The Role) At least 3+ years experience building/managing data pipelines within Databricks. At least 3+ years experience transforming data in Snowflake with tools like DBT. At least 3+ years of experience specifically building data and ML pipelines At least 3 years of experience writing SQL against normalized data structures. Proficiency with code debugging and uncovering performance issues utilizing developer tooling. Proficiency writing data tests. ExperienceProficiency in English language is highly preferred. How You'll Know Youâ€™re on the Right Track Within your first day, you should have been able to clone the repository and install the necessary tooling to build and run our projects in cloud based IDEs such as Databricks and DBT. Within your first week, you will be familiarizing yourself with the code base and coordinating work on development tickets as requested. Within your first month, you should be successfully operating within the development team, submitting PRs, providing feedback on team member PRs, and advancing your assigned projects with your contributions. Within your first year, you should be contributing to the data and software engineering teams to provide your personal insights as to how to improve our processes and architectures. Job Type: Full-time position located in Vietnam governed by Vietnam labour regulations, with the Persefoni entity being established in Vietnam. Interview Process Step 1: Initial screen with talent acquisition Step 2: Technical Interview Step 3: Interview with Vietnam Country Director Step 2: Interview with Engineering Leadership team Step 4: Offer extended Step 5: Background check and onboarding Persefoni is an Equal Opportunity employer We are committed to valuing and respecting people and organizations of all backgrounds. We proudly bring this to life by fostering a culture of innovation, creativity, diversity of thought, and inclusion. We strive for each of our team members to be able to show up for work every day as their genuine selves. Similar to the reverence given to Earthâ€™s biodiversity, we recognize the vast potential that exists when all of the facets of diversity within our team are appreciated and illuminated. This policy extends to all aspects of our employment practices.

job_description: About the Job Position Summary : As the Senior Analyst, Supply Solutions (Furniture), you will be responsible for detailed analysis, execution, and monitoring of the direct import inventory flow. This role ensures smooth and efficient supply solutions, driving timely product availability, minimizing supply chain costs, and providing analytical support for key operational strategies across the global sourcing network. Location : Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam About The Team The Supply Solutions team is accountable for managing inventory, ensuring fulfillment excellence, and overseeing order management from global origins to retail markets. We are dedicated to driving direct import sales growth and unlocking value by ensuring inventory is available while reducing holding, shipping, and production costs. We collaborate with suppliers and internal teams to continuously improve operational efficiency, optimize the supply chain, and meet all sales, in-stock, and inventory goals. About The Role This is a key hands-on, individual contributor role dedicated to operational excellence within the Supply Solutions department. You will utilize deep analytical skills to translate strategic objectives into daily execution, troubleshoot complex constraints, and provide the performance data and insights necessary to optimize supply solutions. You serve as a critical liaison, ensuring alignment and clear communication between our global sourcing network and retail market partners. What You'll Do Analyze and execute supply chain processes to ensure optimal inventory levels, in-stock rates, and cost efficiency across designated categories for retail markets. Conduct detailed operational and financial data analysis to generate critical insights that inform and influence cross-functional decision-making (e.g., Sourcing, Retail). Proactively identify, investigate, and drive the resolution of critical supply chain constraints, order exceptions, and system issues, escalating risks as necessary. Actively contribute to the formulation, development, and implementation of operational strategies and policies aimed at achieving key business KPI goals. Support the development of demand fulfillment strategies with key domestic and global suppliers, ensuring adherence to performance targets. Collaborate with internal teams (Sourcing, Retail, Logistics) to support Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) activities and effective demand/supply balancing. Provide analytical expertise to identify opportunities for cost reduction and actively contribute to the implementation of continuous improvement initiatives across core processes and tools. Evaluate the effectiveness of current operational plans and projects to ensure business needs and fulfillment requirements are consistently met. Serve as a primary communication facilitator, supporting the creation and delivery of training materials and documentation on inventory management best practices for suppliers and internal partners. Support the development of robust methods and dashboards necessary to accurately track, measure, and report departmental and supply chain KPI performance. What You'll Bring Education: Bachelorâ€™s or advanced degree in Supply Chain, Logistics, Engineering, Transportation, Business, or a related field. A minimum of 3-5 years of progressive experience in Supply Chain execution, Logistics, Inventory Management, or related fields. Preferred: Experience working for US Retail, a major brand, or an importer/agent serving major U.S. retail customers. Demonstrated expertise in core supply chain management concepts and their practical application. Proven ability to work independently, manage multiple priorities, and proactively solve complex operational problems. Ability to effectively contribute to continuous improvement projects and initiatives from initiation to completion. Exceptional planning, organizing, and analytical skills, with a strong focus on achieving key objectives. Excellent written and verbal communication and collaboration skills, with a strong command of English. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly MS Excel for complex data manipulation and analysis. Familiarity with or experience utilizing AI-powered tools for enhancing supply chain processes and efficiency. This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities and qualifications for this position. It is not an exhaustive list of all duties and is subject to change based on business needs. Equal Opportunity Employer Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions while being welcoming of all people. Walmart doesnâ€™t charge any recruitment or similar fee in the recruitment process, including but not limited to interview, offering, and onboarding.

job_description: About The Role We're looking for an AI/ML Engineer to join our Insights & Personalization pod within TymeX, a team building the intelligence layer that makes digital banking adaptive, transparent, and deeply personalized. This role is perfect for someone who understands that production ML in financial services isn't just about model accuracy; it's about building trustworthy, explainable systems that customers can rely on with their money. You'll design and deploy machine learning systems across the full stack, from transaction intelligence and behavioral pattern recognition to predictive forecasting, conversational AI, and agentic solutions. You'll be building production systems that customers interact with directly, making the impact of your work tangible and immediate. As part of the Tyme Group operating across multiple markets, you'll build systems that create compounding value as they learn from more data and usage, with the opportunity to see your work scale globally across our digital banking platforms. What You'll Do As an AI/ML Engineer, you'll work across the full ML lifecycle, from model design and experimentation to large-scale deployment and performance optimization, within a distributed, microservices-based, and cloud-native environment. You will: Design, build, and optimize AI/ML pipelines for real-time and batch inference, leveraging modern MLOps practices Collaborate with data engineers and software developers to integrate models into TymeX's banking platform, ensuring reliability, monitoring, and version control Research, prototype, and productionize models in areas such as credit scoring, fraud detection, transaction classification, personalization, and conversational AI Implement robust model evaluation, A/B testing, and drift detection frameworks to ensure accuracy and stability over time Contribute to internal frameworks and libraries to standardize ML development workflows across teams Explore and evaluate emerging techniques in LLMs, Generative AI, and reinforcement learning applicable to TymeX's ecosystem Mentor junior engineers and collaborate closely with product and infrastructure teams to ensure model readiness for global scale Requirements What You'll Bring Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning engineering, data science, or related software development roles Proven experience deploying and maintaining ML models in production environments (preferably in fintech, e-commerce, or large-scale consumer products) Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in Python and core ML libraries (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, XGBoost, etc.) Solid understanding of algorithms, data structures, and distributed computing concepts Experience with MLOps tools (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, Airflow, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines) Familiarity with data engineering stacks such as Spark, Kafka, and cloud data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift) Strong understanding of model monitoring, versioning, and observability in live systems Experience with cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and IaC (Terraform, CloudFormation) is a plus Familiarity with secure data handling and compliance within regulated environments (e.g., banking or financial data) is advantageous Mindset: A system-thinking approach to ML development, viewing models as part of a continuous delivery ecosystem Curiosity for applied AI research balanced with pragmatism for production constraints Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in cross-functional and multi-country teams Benefits Why You'll Love Working Here Opportunity to build large-scale AI systems that power global digital banking across multiple markets Work in a cloud-native, event-driven, and API-first architecture with cutting-edge technologies Join a team where AI is not an experiment; it's a core part of the platform strategy Hybrid working model, strong engineering culture, and continuous learning environment (LLMs, MLOps, data observability, and more) Be part of a global technology organization with shared ownership and impact

job_description: As a Customer Experience Lead, your primary responsibility is to ensure that users' interactions with our products and services meet and exceed their expectations across various touchpoints. You will play a crucial role in enhancing overall user satisfaction by monitoring and managing the user journey, identifying pain points, and implementing improvements. Your focus will extend to both the qualitative and quantitative aspects of customer experience, translating metrics into actionable insights. This role requires a keen eye for detail, excellent analytical skills, and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing potential challenges in the customer journey. Success in this position will contribute significantly to building a positive brand image and fostering long-term customer relationships. What you will do User Journey Management: Oversee the entire user journey to ensure a seamless and positive experience across all touchpoints. Align services performance with defined standards and user expectations. Experience Monitoring and Improvement: Develop and manage a robust User Experience Journey to track user satisfaction, identify pain points, and pinpoint opportunities for enhancement. Utilize customer experience metrics to derive in-depth insights, offering practical and actionable recommendations for improvement. Performance Metrics Definition and Monitoring: Define and monitor key performance metrics related to services to proactively identify and address potential gaps. Translate performance metrics into meaningful insights to drive strategic decisions. Continuous Improvement Initiatives: Drive improvement initiatives to resolve user pain points and address services performance gaps. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement changes that positively impact the overall customer experience. Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with various stakeholders to gain a deep understanding of operational processes. Investigate problem areas within processes and recommend transformational solutions to enhance the customer experience. Project management: Assist the Customer Experience Management Team in implementing improvement projects related to customer operations. Contribute to the development and execution of strategies that elevate customer satisfaction and loyalty. What you will need At least 5 years of experience in the customer experience field. Strong skills in customer journey mapping and data analytics to define customer experience and service performance metrics. Logical and structured thinking with strong attention to detail. Excellent problem-solving skills and a passion for root cause analysis to connect the dots. Willing to explore new standards and global best practices to optimize solutions. Experience or knowledge in process design and/or project management/or Business Analyst (BA)/or Product Owner (PO) is a plus. Thrives in a fast-paced environment and is eager to learn and adapt. Passionate about enhancing customer satisfaction and experience every day. Company Culture: Our company culture is built on Customer Centricity, Innovation, Teamwork, Excellence in Execution, Constant Learning. We value diversity and inclusivity and strive to create an environment where everyone are inspired to grow and succeed fast together.

Additional Information Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves: Finance: Competitive salary package, referral bonus; Career Development : Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership; Learning Opportunities: Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences; Work-Life Balance: Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme; Health: Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps; Community: Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.

job_description: MealSuite, an Inc. 5000 Fastest-Growing Company, is a privately owned SaaS organization comprising 190+ team members across the globe, with hub locations in Cambridge, ON, Canada, Dallas, TX, USA, and Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. Ourâ€¯suite of end-to-end foodservice technology solutions helps professionals across healthcare and aging services streamline their operations, save time, reduce food waste, and meet regulatory requirements, so they can focus on what matters most: improving the quality of patient and resident care. We are looking for a Frontend developer to join our development team on our mission to revolutionize the continuum of care through our all-in-one foodservice management technology. As part of our Development team, your mission is to stay on top of the latest releases, contribute to projects, and deliver the best quality solutions for our customers. A day in the life as a Manual Tester: Review system requirements and design documents, then create, execute and document detailed, accurate test cases Perform functional, integration, and regression testing on our customer facing websites-both desktop and mobile Keep the Manual test case repository updated with the current state of project requirements Work on automating test cases that can be automated to improve test cycles Participate in the Scrum Squad project structure (e.g., Attend scrum meetings, plan, and provide estimation). Work with stakeholders and Product Owners to understand evolving project requirements and build test plans/test cases Log / Track bug tickets identified during different test phases and work with developers to ensure proper resolution Identify improvements that can be implemented in the QA process Assist Product Owners in the creation and tracking of executable acceptance criteria Keep Jira updated with status of assigned tickets, add required information while reopening or closing the tickets so that it can referenced when required Triage defects and identify blockers early so Squad team and business are aware of potential impacts Others urgent task provided by leader or manager If the below describe your knowledge, experience and character, this role could be for you: Good understanding of Jira, Testrail, and any others bug tracking system Strong mindset of a manual tester Understanding of SDLC, STLC and Agile methodologies Prior experience working in an Agile product development environment Excellent skill of writing test cases, test suite, test plan, etc Experience liaising with development, product owners, and other business stakeholders Experience testing APIs using Postman Ability to understand requirements with less documentation. Knowledge in SQL queries and working with large amount of data Exceptional communication skills, both written and oral; strong interpersonal and organizational skills Prior experience coordinating and working with international teams Must be able to work flexible hours We know imposter syndrome can be REAL when applying for a new role, but please don't let the confidence gap prevent you from taking a leap and applying for your dream job. Generous Time Offâ€¯ - up to 20 days of annual leave to recharge and refresh. 100% Salary During Probation â€¯- No drop in pay while you ramp up. Continuous Learningâ€¯ - Unlimited access to online courses through Udemy to support your growth. Top-Notch Equipmentâ€¯ - MacBook Pro provided for your work needs. Office Perksâ€¯ - Free snacks and beverages to keep you fueled. Flexible Working Timeâ€¯ - We care about outcomes, over rigid schedules. Team Eventsâ€¯ - Regular activities to connect, celebrate, and have fun. Meaningful Work â€¯- Build awesome products that make a real impact. Have we got your attention? Great! Here's what's next: Apply today with your resume and answers any application questions. We'll start reviewing candidates within two weeks of this position being posted and will reach out to you if we'd like to get to know you a bit better. We often get hundreds of applications for our roles (we feel very honoured that so many people are interested!) and try our best to get back to each person. If there's a delay in our response, please don't think we've forgotten about you. We may be taking our time to thoroughly review each candidate before deciding who to interview.
