location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
job_description: Job Description Participate in analyzing, designing, and developing cloud-based products and services. Design and build backend APIs/Services for application systems using open-source or commercial libraries. Research and apply Distributed Computing, Microservices Architecture, Cloud Computing, and AI technologies to applications/services. Work with Docker containerization, Kubernetes orchestration, GitLab, and CI/CD pipelines. Report progress and execute tasks assigned by the manager. Continuously learn and update new technologies as required. Requirements Minimum 3 years of backend development experience with NodeJS/Java or other backend languages. At least 1 year of experience in API development. Strong understanding of Microservices architecture. Proficiency in Linux environments. Experience designing and developing backend APIs/Services using SQL databases (MySQL, SQL Server) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Redis), with a focus on scalability and performance. Hands-on experience with Git (GitHub/GitLab). Understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies. Proactive, eager to learn, responsible, and a strong team player. Strong system-thinking, logical reasoning, and fundamental knowledge of data structures & algorithms. Benefits Competitive fixed salary + annual KPI bonus. Labor contract, full insurance package, 12 annual leave days, and public holidays per government regulations. Performance and salary review twice a year. Three-tier income structure with monthly and yearly KPI bonuses (average total annual income 1415 months). Training opportunities with major technology partners (Microsoft, IBM, Google, etc.). Aon Care health insurance (inpatient & outpatient). Holiday bonuses according to company policy. Opportunity to work on large-scale, multi-industry projects using cutting-edge technologies. Mentorship from senior experts and team leads. Creative and innovative working environment; modern, green, international-standard office. 5-day workweek (44 hours/week), weekends off. Team-building activities, sports clubs, esports, company events, and special medical care programs for employees.

job_title: Senior AI Engineer/ Data Scientist (HCM/ Hanoi)
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: COMPANY DESCRIPTION Bosch Global Software Technologies Company Limited (BGSV) is 100% owned subsidiary of Robert Bosch GmbH, offering end-to-end Engineering, IT, and Business Solutions. Starting its operation from 2010 at Etown 2 in HCMC, BGSV is the first software development center of Bosch in Southeast Asia. BGSV nowadays have over 4,000 associates, with a global footprint and presence in the US, Europe, and the Asia Pacific region. With our unique ability to offer end-to-end solutions that connect sensors, software, and services, we enable businesses to move from the traditional to digital or improve businesses by introducing a digital element in their products and processes. BGSV currently operates from three offices located at the following addresses: 1. Etown Building â€“ 364 Cong Hoa Street, Ward 13, Tan Binh District, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam 2. OfficeHaus Building â€“ 32 Tan Thang Street, Son Ky Ward, Tan Phu District, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam 3. Capital Place Building â€“ 29 Lieu Giai Street, Ngoc Khanh Ward, Ba Dinh District, Hanoi, Vietnam Job Description JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for a Senior AI Engineer / Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you will design and implement cutting-edge AI solutions leveraging Python, Machine Learning, Large Language Models (LLMs), and classical NLP techniques . You will collaborate with a team of experts to analyze data, build scalable models, and develop innovative GenAI solutions that drive business impact. Additionally, you will mentor junior team members and may take ownership of specific AI topics or projects. Location: This position is open for talents in Ho Chi Minh City & Hanoi Key Responsibilities Design, develop, and implement advanced machine learning algorithms, models, and LLM-based pipelines . Analyze large datasets to uncover insights and patterns that support data-driven decisions. Write production-quality Python code , following best practices (version control, testing, documentation). Collaborate cross-functionally to understand business needs and translate them into AI-driven solutions. Stay current with emerging trends and advancements in AI, GenAI, and Data Science . Integrate AI models into production systems in collaboration with software engineering teams. Mentor and guide junior data scientists and engineers , fostering a culture of continuous learning. Qualifications Education: Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Data Science , or a related field. Experience: Minimum 5 years in Data Science or AI Engineering roles. Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in Python and standard ML frameworks. Deep understanding of machine learning algorithms and techniques . Hands-on experience with LLMs and RAG/agent frameworks (e.g., LangChain, LlamaIndex, etc.). Proficiency in Natural Language Processing (NLP) techniques and libraries. Soft Skills: Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills. Proven ability to work independently while contributing effectively to a team environment. High attention to detail and strong task prioritization skills. Language Skills: Fluent in English WHY BOSCH? Be part of a dynamic, globally recognized company at the forefront of digital innovation. Work in a collaborative and creative environment that fosters growth and learning. Contribute to meaningful projects that have a real impact on the future of AI. If you are excited about data science, AI, and the opportunity to create innovative solutions that make a positive impact, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and help shape the future of AI at Bosch. Career Opportunities & Benefits: Work in one of the Best Places to Work in Vietnam Impactful Work: The opportunity to contribute to the development of innovative software solutions that make a real difference. Collaborative Environment: A supportive and collaborative team environment where your ideas are valued, and your contributions are recognized. Growth Potential: A clear path for professional development and advancement within a growing company. Join a dynamic and fast-growing global company (English-speaking environment) Get 13th-month salary bonus + attractive performance bonus (you'll love it!) + annual performance appraisal 100% monthly basic salary and mandatory social insurances in 2-month probation Onsite opportunities: short-term and long-term assignments 15++ days of annual leave + 1 day of birthday leave Premium health insurance for employee and 02 family members Flexible working time Lunch and parking allowance Good benefits of company activities Opportunity to work in global projects of fast developing company and being a part of innovation team contributing initiative ideas to the hi-tech world. Engage in our diverse training programs which surely help strengthen both your personal

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About TymeX TymeX is Tyme Group's Technology & Product Development Hub with a global mission to become serial bank builders. Our Financial Crime platform plays a critical role in protecting customers and the bank from fraud, money laundering, and other financial crimes using advanced data, analytics, AI, and automation. About The Role We're looking for a Lead Risk Technology Architect with a Non-Financial Risk background to join our Financial Crime team. You'll be part of the group responsible for designing, building and maintaining high-performance AML & fraud detection systems, entity resolution, and compliance analytics across Tyme's ecosystem. The goal of the Financial Crime Platform is to reduce friction, improve outcomes for genuine customers, reduce costs and reduce vendor dependency, by architecting a unified non-siloed platform across Fraud and Financial Crime for the whole Tyme Group entities. You'll work with large, complex transactions, customer behaviour and apply models and decisioning frameworks in Databricks, integrate data from multiple systems in real time and batch, and help design the data foundation for real-time risk detection and case management. Key Responsibilities Demonstrated experience in multiple forms of data ingestion, event-based streaming, synchronous real time ingestion approaches Architect our SLM (localized LLM) strategy Use the above as the basis for building a low cost, but high performance multi-agent AI architecture with the ability to create an ontology via knowledge graphs Design the ODS LDM and the Star/Snowflake LDM to support knowledge storing, sharing, audit and re-use for Agentic AI to store, forward, capture knowledge and decisions made. Apply entity resolution techniques in place, without further data movement Be a proponent of not moving large scale data movement to multiple data sinks, process data in place rather than move data to different sinks Be a proponent of the SHIFT LEFT paradigm and be a Data Foundation proponent Utilize tooling that allows SHIFT LEFT, for example instead of a physical Graph Database, a virtual Graph Database sitting on top of a solid Data Foundation. Understand real time scaling and performance needs for fast track processing, near real time and slow track batch oriented needs and which types of Compute, GPU and storage to apply and appropriate Notebook technologies (Scala, PySpark, Python, SQL) Understand how to construct and deploy natively or via third party LLMOps and MLOps and how a comprehensive Data & AI monitoring strategy can be put into place Be a proponent of Governance, Lineage, Auditability, Data As A Product (Data Contracts) via utilizing the power of the Unity Catalog across the entire architecture Design systems to lower cost, require less IT support and to be adaptable/flexible. Collaborate closely with Data Scientists, Analysts, Compliance, Operations and our Product/Feature teams to operationalize models and rules Integrate with external systems (e.g. sanctions, ID&V, biometrics and authentication systems) to enrich risk and identity data by building a rich profiling layer capable of supporting detection and investigation. Profiling for sub-millisecond needs in fraud detection architecturally and for slower profiling for investigations Requirements Must-Have: Bachelor's degree or above - ideally in Computer Science with specialization in Data Architecture/AI 10-15 years of experience, preference in Financial Services, Fast Moving E-Commerce industries Held the position of Lead Risk Architect at one of the above industries with a suitable size customer base and designed global/multi-country systems Hands on experience demonstrating architecture, design and implementation of Financial Crime or Cyber Security detection systems using Databricks, Snowflake, GCP Big Query/Table and/or Cloudera type systems. Systems designed on other architectural or older architectural paradigms are not what we are looking for, but a migration of knowledge from these to modern systems is critical Experience working with structured and unstructured data in a production environment Secure Coding practices - testing/QA in Spark, Python, PySpark, PostGreSQL, Databricks SQL Comfortable with cloud-based platforms (preferably AWS, but good data engineering on GCP is also welcomed) Good communication skills in English â€” able to collaborate with cross-functional teams in an international environment Proficiency in working with Text, Delta, Parquet, Iceberg/S3, JSON, CSV, and XML data formats Working knowledge of Kafka/MQ/Spark structured real time streaming Solid understanding of git-based version control, DevOps, and CI/CD Experience of working on Atlassian stack Knowledge of common web API frameworks and web services Strong teamwork, relationship, and client management skills, and the ability to influence peers and senior management to accomplish team goals Willingness to embrace modern technology, best practice, and ways of work Nice to Have: Preference for Databricks/Snowflake/GCP Data certification at several levels in Data Engineering, Gen AI, Data Architecture Experience with Agentic AI, MLFlow, Judge Based Eval Models Experience with building LLMs, RAG and other approaches, with mastery in prompt engineering Familiarity with Entity Resolution frameworks (e.g., Quantexa, Senzing, open source Entity Resolution tools) Experience with data streaming frameworks (Kafka, Spark Streaming, MQ) Experience with Regulatory Model Validation against AI Benefits Why You'll Love Working Here Be part of a mission-driven team tackling real-world financial crime problems Work with modern data tech stack with Agentic AI and advanced ML Hybrid working model with flexible hours International and collaborative culture â€” working with colleagues across Vietnam, Singapore, Philippines and South Africa Competitive salary, performance bonuses, and learning support

job_description: Dive into NVIDIA's realm, contributing to AI and deep learning, shaping global technology in various fields. Apply techniques in text normalization and audio-text alignment to prepare large-scale datasets for advanced speech processing tasks. Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to translate requirements into practical tool building and implementation. Conduct comprehensive testing and validation to meet exacting internal quality standards. Assist in the deployment of modern advancements geared towards improving NVIDIAâ€™s speech and language AI technologies. What We Need To See Current enrollment in a Bachelorâ€™s, Masterâ€™s, or PhD program in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Strong programming experience in Python (or a comparable language). Familiarity with ML frameworks/libraries (e.g., PyTorch or TensorFlow). Foundational knowledge of NLP and speech recognition concepts. Collaborative, inclusive approach with strong problem-solving skills and curiosity. Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd Hands-on experience with NVIDIAâ€™s NeMo toolkit or similar platforms for speech and language processing. Previous internships or substantial project experience in data engineering or machine learning for speech applications. Direct knowledge of techniques for audio signal processing and text normalization. JR2008037

job_title: AI Engineer (Adaptive Feedback & Assessment/Learner Graph & Recommendations)
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Loved by over 220,000 users, Geniebook is Singaporeâ€™s largest online learning platform for English, Mathematics and Science (EMS) syllabi, with Chinese being our newest subject offering. From AI-personalised worksheets to live classes and teacher chats, we are a powerful suite of complementary learning products designed to help students accelerate their academic performance. Weâ€™re looking out for amazing global talents to scale Geniebook exponentially across Southeast Asia, and we have many exciting roles opening up across a wide range of functions. So join us today to inspire a new generation of learners and help even more students learn smarter and do better! AI Engineer #1 â€“ Adaptive Feedback Assessment Own the brains behind Genieâ€™s instant feedback: deliver marking, commenting, and note-summary models that feel human, hit â‰¥ 95 % accuracy, and answer in Key Responsibilities Train fine-tune NLP / vision models for Math Science auto-marking, AI commenting and class-note summarisation. Build retrieval-augmented explanation pipelines so every hint cites workbook lines or teacher notes. Ship fast: instrument latency, automate regression tests on 2 k+ sample sets, and roll out safely via feature flags. Work with Curriculum to label edge-case data and measure real-world accuracy weekly. Add guard-rails â€” bias checks, â€œdouble-check with a teacherâ€ fallback when confidence dips. Success Looks Like 95 %+ exact-match score on marking benchmark; p95 latency < 1 s in prod. < 0.5 % unresolved feedback disputes per quarter. Models & infra ready for staged roll-outs (staff â†’ beta â†’ all) with zero downtime. Requirements 3 + yrs building NLP or multimodal ML systems in Python (PyTorch / TensorFlow). Hands-on with transformers, LoRA / PEFT, RAG, and prompt-engineering best practice. Solid software chops: FastAPI or equivalent, CI/CD, Docker/K8s, AWS or GCP. Obsessed with measurement and rapid experiment cycles. Nice-to-Haves Education-tech, grading, or document-understanding experience. Familiarity with Vision-Language models for diagram questions. Singapore work authorisation (role is SG-hybrid; remote SEA considered for the right fit). ------------------------------- AI Engineer #2 â€“ Learner Graph Recommendations Design the intelligence that makes Genie a â€œsmart-cool friendâ€ â€” a mastery graph, progress road-maps, and streak-goal engine that boost weekly practice by +20 %. Key Responsibilities Model concept mastery and temporal learning gaps in a graph database (Neo4j / Amazon Neptune). Build recommender services that output next-best-question sets and personalised streak targets. Collaborate with Product Design to expose explainer APIs (â€œWhy Genie recommended thisâ€). Own real-time data pipelines (Kinesis / Kafka) feeding the graph with practice logs and class interactions. A/B test algorithms; lift practice minutes by â‰¥ 15 %, track WAU/MAU and retention impact. Success Looks Like Recommender boosts average practice minutes +15 % within 7 days of exposure. Gen-2 streak engine live by 15 Oct 2025 with < 0.05 CLS impact on web/mobile. Learner Graph uptime 99.9 %, < 100 ms P99 recommendation latency. Requirements 3 + yrs in recommender systems, graph or sequence modelling, strong SQL + Python. Production experience with graph databases and AWS data tooling (Glue, Redshift, Kinesis). Proven A/B experimentation mindset; fluent in statistical evaluation. Ability to partner with front-end teams on SDK contracts and telemetry. Nice-to-Haves Reinforcement-learning or bandits in user-engagement contexts. Prior work on gamification or ed-tech analytics. Familiarity with TypeScript/React for light SDK contributions. ----------------------- Why Geniebook? Mission â€” help Every1 reach A1 using cutting-edge AI. Scale â€” millions of answers, live classes, and chat sessions to learn from. Autonomy â€” own a pillar of the 2025-2027 roadmap and see it in customersâ€™ hands fast. Culture â€” small, execution-obsessed team where shipping beats slide-ware.

location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
job_description: Our Journey ShopBack began in 2014 as a late-night spark of inspiration between Henry and Joel â€” not just to build a Cashback platform, but to reimagine how brands and consumers connect. As former advertisers, they understood the limitations of traditional marketing, and saw an opportunity to deliver more value on both sides. That idea quickly turned into action, and the first prototype was built over a weekend with the other co-founders. Today, ShopBack serves over 50 million users across 13 markets, partners with 20,000+ merchants, and powers over half a million transactions daily. We're building The Worldâ€™s Most Rewarding Way to Shop â€” and looking for bold, driven individuals to join us. About The Role At ShopBack, our engineering teams build scalable platforms and utilize leading technologies to build a world-class product. You will join a diverse and talented team of aspiring engineers with great ambition to impact the eCommerce landscape. We are seeking team members who strive to solve hard problems, take pride in delivering world-class products, and are strong team players. You will get an opportunity to work on building scalable data systems that help drive the organizationâ€™s data-driven decision-making and play a direct impact on growth. Our Data Platform team builds and maintains the foundation that powers ShopBackâ€™s analytics and decision-making. We design and operate data pipelines across AWS S3, Apache Iceberg, and Trino, orchestrated through Airflow and modeled via dbt-on-Spark. Youâ€™ll work alongside experienced data engineers who value clean data, efficient systems, and thoughtful design, not just working code. Your Adventure Ahead Build and maintain data models and pipelines using Spark and Apache Airflow Learn to design and optimize HUDI and Iceberg tables for performance and reliability Write and validate SQL transformations consumed in Trino and Metabase Collaborate with senior engineers to improve data quality and observability Use AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Cursor, Claude Code) to assist coding and documentation, and learn how to verify their output Document learnings and share improvements through Confluence and Slack What You Will Learn How modern data lakehouses (Spark + Iceberg + Trino) work in production Building reliable, testable dbt models on top of large datasets End-to-end flow: ingestion â†’ transformation â†’ analytics Practical debugging, observability, and version control in a real system How to collaborate effectively in a hybrid engineering team Essentials To Succeed Strong interest in data engineering or data systems Familiarity with Python and SQL (school projects or self-taught is fine) Curiosity about data pipelines, storage formats, and data quality Comfort experimenting with AI coding assistants responsibly Clear communication, asks questions early, shares progress regularly Bonus: exposure to AWS, dbt, Spark, or Trino ShopBackers' DNA Grit - We tackle all challenges head-on, working together to solve problems and achieve success. Hunger - We value hard work, and having relentless drive. Speed - We move fast and have a bias for action, all to deliver maximum impact. Impact - We focus on results, always aiming for the best possible outcomes and timelines. Growth - We embrace a growth mindset, constantly striving to learn, improve, and excel in our roles. Exclusively for ShopBackers Career progression paths and opportunities to take on greater challenges that help you realise your ambitions. Be part of a winning team on a journey to global scale. Competitive compensation based on your performance. Candid, open, and collaborative culture where feedback is valued, for everyone to grow and improve every day. ShopBack is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other protected status under applicable laws. Join our team and help us make a difference! We are committed to protecting your data and ensuring fairness in our recruitment process. We may use automated tools, including AI, to help our team screen applications, match candidates to roles, generate interview notes, and review assessments. These tools assist our recruiters and interviewers and they do not make final hiring decisions. If an assessment is part of your process, we may (with your consent) capture screen activity and/or webcam images during the test to help verify test integrity. We do not use AI to infer your emotions or sensitive traits. We process personal data lawfully, securely, and transparently in line with applicable data-protection laws and our commitment to fair employment. You can ask questions or exercise your rights including to request human review or to challenge an outcome by contacting [email protected] . We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Trusting Social is an AI Fintech pioneer that's revolutionizing credit access in emerging markets. Our mission is "Advancing AI to Meet the Financial Needs of Everyday Consumers with Empathy." We've assessed over 1 billion consumers across four countries, and we're on a mission to provide 100 million credit lines using the power of AI and Big Data. How You'll Make An Impact As a Voice AI Engineer, you'll go beyond building models - you'll architect our "Digital Humans." You'll design the orchestration layer that enables our AI agents to listen, reason, and respond in real-time, seamlessly connecting rigid banking systems with the natural flow of human conversation in financial advisory scenarios. What You'll Do You'll spearhead the development of our real-time omnichannel communication platform, focusing on creating voice agents that feel truly human: low-latency, intuitive, and capable of handling nuanced financial discussions with empathy and precision. End-to-end pipeline orchestration: Design and optimize the complete conversational flow: voice activity detection (VAD) â†’ automatic speech recognition (ASR) â†’ large language model (LLM) reasoning â†’ text-to-speech (TTS). Latency optimization: Target sub-1200ms end-to-end perceived latency using techniques like stream-to-stream processing. Advanced speech understanding: Fine-tune a speech foundation model with multiple speech understanding capabilities, including automatic speech recognition (ASR), spoken language identification (LID), speech emotion recognition (SER), and audio event detection (AED) Advanced speech generation: TTS models for controllably expressive and emotional speech generation: natural prosody, emotional tone, and adaptation to local Southeast Asian dialects and accents. Develop voice cloning for consistent, brand-aligned agents that convey warmth during sensitive financial topics. Turn-taking & interruptibility: Build robust logic for handling interruptions (barge-in), background noise, filler words, and natural pauses, ensuring smooth, human-like dialogue. Agent memory: Embed memory into the voice pipeline for real-time, accurate delivery of personalized communication across channels, without disrupting conversation flow. System reliability & evaluation: Develop agent versioning, conduct A/B testing, and track key internal voice agent / biz-related metrics for user engagement to continuously improve interactions. What We're Looking For The Voice stack: 3+ years of experience in Machine Learning/Software Engineering with deep expertise in Speech-to-Text (STT) and Text-to-Speech (TTS) architectures. Real-time protocols: Proficiency in managing low-latency audio streaming and bidirectional communication using WebRTC, WebSockets. Programming mastery: Advanced proficiency in Python, specifically leveraging FastAPI and AsyncIO for high-concurrency systems, alongside hands-on experience with Deep Learning frameworks like PyTorch. Data & audio engineering: Hands-on experience with Librosa and FFmpeg to minimize audio processing overhead and optimize feature extraction. The "VoiceAI" mindset: You understand that a great voice agent isn't just a fast model; it's a perfectly timed, natural interaction. Bonus points: MLOps & DevOps: Strong command of DevOps and MLOps methodologies, featuring hands-on proficiency in containerization (Docker) or orchestration (Kubernetes). Inference & serving: Demonstrated expertise in model optimization and deployment using engines like ONNX and TensorRT, with experience managing serving frameworks such as Triton Inference Server and Ray (especially if you can demonstrate performance gains through benchmarking). Full-Stack awareness: Capable of building responsive user interfaces and web applications using React or Next.js. What We Offer Join our vibrant team and enjoy: Opportunity to work and learn from one of the best and brightest technology teams in Vietnam Be part of a winning team with exponential growth regionally, experience recruiting world-class talents Competitive compensation package, including 13th-month salary and performance bonuses Comprehensive health care coverage for you and your dependents Generous leave policies, including annual leave, sick leave, and flexible work hours Convenient central district 1 office location, next to a future metro station Onsite lunch with multiple options, including vegetarian Grab for work allowance and fully equipped workstations Fun and engaging team building activities, sponsored sports clubs, and happy hour every Thursday Unlimited free coffee, tea, snacks, and fruit to keep you energized An opportunity to make a social impact by helping to democratize credit access in emerging markets At Trusting Social, we live by ownership, integrity, and agility in execution. We believe in doing what's right, what's best, and what's innovative. If you're smart, driven, and want to make a difference in the world with the most advanced and fascinating technology, come join our team. We offer the runway to truly make an impact. location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
job_description: The mission of Speechify is to make sure that reading is never a barrier to learning. Over 50 million people use Speechify's text-to-speech products to turn whatever they're reading â€“ PDFs, books, Google Docs, news articles, websites â€“ into audio, so they can read faster, read more, and remember more. Speechify's text-to-speech reading products include its iOS app, Android App, Mac App, Chrome Extension, and Web App. Google recently named Speechify the Chrome Extension of the Year and Apple named Speechify its 2025 Design Award winner for Inclusivity. Today, nearly 200 people around the globe work on Speechify in a 100% distributed setting â€“ Speechify has no office. These include frontend and backend engineers, AI research scientists, and others from Amazon, Microsoft, and Google, leading PhD programs like Stanford, high growth startups like Stripe, Vercel, Bolt, and many founders of their own companies. Overview We're looking to hire for our Data side of our AI team at Speechify. This role is responsible for all aspects of data collection to support our model training operations. We are able to build high-quality datasets at petabyte-scale and low cost through a tight integration of infrastructure, engineering, and research work. We are looking for a skilled Software Engineer to join us. What You'll Do Be scrappy to find new sources of audio data and bring it into our ingestion pipeline Operate and extend the cloud infrastructure for our ingestion pipeline, currently running on GCP and managed with Terraform. Collaborate closely with our Scientists to shift the cost/throughput/quality frontier, delivering richer data at bigger scale and lower cost to power our next-generation models. Collaborate with others on the AI Team and Speechify Leadership to craft the AI Team's dataset roadmap to power Speechify's next-generation consumer and enterprise products. An Ideal Candidate Should Have BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or a related field. 5+ years of industry experience in software development. Proficiency with bash/Python scripting in Linux environments Proficiency in Docker and Infrastructure-as-Code concepts and professional experience with at least one major Cloud Provider (we use GCP) Experience with web crawlers, large-scale data processing workflows is a plus Ability to handle multiple tasks and adapt to changing priorities. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. What we offer A fast-growing environment where you can help shape the company and product. An entrepreneurial-minded team that supports risk, intuition, and hustle. A hands-off management approach so you can focus and do your best work. An opportunity to make a big impact in a transformative industry. Competitive salaries, a friendly and laid-back atmosphere, and a commitment to building a great asynchronous culture. Opportunity to work on a life-changing product that millions of people use. Build products that directly impact and support people with learning differences like dyslexia, ADD, low vision, concussions, autism, and more. Work in one of the fastest-growing sectors of tech, the intersection of artificial intelligence and audio. Think you're a good fit for this job? Tell us more about yourself and why you're interested in the role when you apply. And don't forget to include links to your portfolio and LinkedIn. Not looking but know someone who would make a great fit? Refer them! Speechify is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Speechify does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_description: Objectives We are looking for Business Intelligence to bridge the gap between ERP operations and digital marketing performance to provide end-to-end business visibility. Job Description Business Intelligence & Insight Development Act as a Business Intelligence partner for internal teams and selected clients. Provide business context, domain knowledge, and data understanding to support model development and feature selection. Stakeholder Collaboration & Communication Work closely with Marketing, Account, Finance, and Operation teams to understand their needs and challenges. Business & Marketing Domain Knowledge Strong understanding of digital marketing concepts and metrics: Paid media performance, funnel, attribution, ROI. Ability to connect marketing data with business outcomes. Experience working with ERP, finance, or operational data is a strong plus. Accounting or finance knowledge is an advantage. Soft Skills & Mindset Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. Good communication skills; able to explain data insights clearly. Ownership mindset with ability to work independently. Collaborative, proactive, and eager to learn. Nice-to-have Experience applying forecasting or machine learning models. Experience in digital marketing agencies or performance-driven environments. job_description: Overview Momos is a rapidly growing startup headquartered in San Diego and Singapore, building AI for customers at every location. Momos works with leading enterprise multi-location brands and QSRs globally, such as Firehouse Subs, Shake Shack, and Baskins Robbins, and powers the entire customer stack with AI for 20,000 locations globally. At Momos, our core principle is putting restaurants at the forefront of everything we do. The Role We are seeking a Business Analyst to transform data into clear, actionable insights for both internal teams and customers. You will develop reporting systems, design dashboards, automate analyses, and deliver narrative-driven recommendations that improve product, operational, and commercial performance. Conduct recurring analyses to measure performance, customer behavior, and market movements. Develop market and competitive intelligence to support strategic decision-making. Support regional and functional teams with ad-hoc analysis and reporting requests. Communication & Enablement Translate complex analyses into clear, business-focused recommendations. Establish standardized KPI frameworks and data visualization templates. Drive insight adoption by embedding metrics and recommendations into daily workflows. Requirements Ideal Background: We welcome applicants across levels â€” from Junior to Senior Business Analyst â€” who demonstrate strong analytical thinking, curiosity, and the ability to translate data into impact. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Analytics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field. 1-5 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, consulting, or revenue operations. Solid proficiency in SQL for querying and transforming large datasets. Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker. Strong analytical storytelling and presentation skills; ability to communicate clearly with technical and non-technical audiences. Familiarity with cloud data platforms (Snowflake, BigQuery, Postgres, AWS) and spreadsheets for automation. Highly organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment. Nice to Have Experience with Python, dbt, or Airflow for automation. Exposure to A/B testing, causal inference, or marketing attribution modeling. Background in F&B tech, multi-location retail, or Adtech. job_description: Company Description Carousell Group is the leading multi-category platform for secondhand in Greater Southeast Asia on a mission to make secondhand the first choice. Qualifications Bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. Minimum of 2 years of experience in finance, trading support, or risk management. Solid understanding of P&L concepts. English: Full professional proficiency in both spoken and written. Exposure to international environments and cross-functional collaboration is an advantage. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Outlook is essential. Familiarity with financial reporting tools is an advantage. Experience with Power BI or Power Query is a plus. Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities. Additional Information Key results expected In-depth analysis. Timely completion of all tasks with high accuracy. Entrepreneurial mindset and adaptability to change.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About GHN Giao HÃ ng Nhanh (GHN) is one of Vietnamâ€™s leading logistics companies, proudly delivering exceptional services with the commitment: â€œSmarter, Faster, More Cost-Effective.â€ GHN empowers millions of businesses to optimize their operations while creating thousands of jobs for the Vietnamese workforce. Founded with the mission to revolutionize the logistics industry and guided by a technology-driven vision, GHN continuously integrates advanced technological solutions into every delivery. This enables streamlined operations, enhanced delivery performance, and a fast, safe, and efficient customer experience - serving a wide range of clients including E-commerce platforms, retailers, and individual consumers. With a nationwide network spanning all 34 provinces and cities, a forward-thinking innovation strategy, and robust logistics infrastructure, GHN continues to affirm its position as a pioneer in Vietnamâ€™s rapidly growing E-commerce and logistics sector. Why Join GHN This is a pivotal opportunity to join a rapidly growing e-commerce delivery leader in Vietnam, where your contributions will directly impact our strategic direction and market position. You will be part of a team that embraces cutting-edge technologies, data-driven innovation & discruption to solve real-world problems and enhance millions of lives. We offer a dynamic and collaborative environment where you can leverage your expertise, grow professionally through challenging projects, and make a significant impact on our success. About the Category Management Department The Category Management Department at GHN is the pivotal, data-driven unit responsible for driving operational excellence and strategy execution in the SME segment. We translate business objectives into high-performance processes by focusing on: Strategic Pricing & Planning: Developing pricing models and executing sales/business plans. Policy & Process Optimization: Setting clear policies and streamlining daily operations for efficiency. Risk & Compliance: Implementing rigorous internal controls and ensuring system compliance. Our work is built on a data culture and defined by the core principles of Timeliness, Consistency, and Accuracy. Job Summary We seek a results-oriented Category Executive to ensure the effective translation of SME strategy into operational reality via system configuration and execution. The role centers on the control and optimization of critical processes, particularly Pricing and Sales Compliance. The Executive acts as the central link for policy deployment to the Sales Team and utilizes data analysis extensively to monitor performance, compliance, and generate actionable insights, adhering strictly to the principles of Timeliness, Consistency, and Accuracy. Key Responsibilities: A. Pricing & System Execution (60% Operational Focus) This section focuses on the accurate configuration, control, and execution of core pricing and sales processes. 1. Pricing System Configuration & Catalog Management Design & Configuration: Design pricing tables (based on strategy/sales requirements) and create necessary files for accurate system configuration. Catalog Management: Store and maintain the official pricing catalog, ensuring its integrity and accessibility. Contract Setup: Configure surcharges and contract-related parameters on the system for customer agreements. Workflow & Visibility: Accurately set up price approval workflows (between configuration staff and management) and control visibility for the Sales Team. Legal Compliance: Monitor, store documentation, and coordinate with the Legal department for necessary legal registration of pricing tables. 2. Sales Process Execution E-form Execution: Drive the execution of standard business processes designed on e-forms. Operational Management: Manage critical operational tasks such as customer lead transfer, account changes, and enterprise eKYC. 3. Price Reconciliation & Risk Control Price Reconciliation: Perform reconciliation of pricing and surcharges (e.g., monthly return fees) to address sales price variances. Commitment Reconciliation: Conduct project/volume-based reconciliation to adjust preferential prices/discounts based on customer volume commitment achievement. Risk Control: Perform reconciliation checks to control risks related to sales scope, pricing, and potential process abuse (e.g., cheating, promotion misuse). B. Reporting & Business Planning Support (40% Data Analytics Focus) This section focuses on providing strategic data, tracking performance, and supporting planning cycles. 1. Reporting & Performance Tracking Revenue Tracking: Prepare and monitor actual revenue vs. target reports for sales teams (Region/Head Office). Planning Support: Assist with sales forecast updates (Yearly to Weekly) and target sales allocation. 2. Incentive & Optimization Incentive Support: Support incentive calculations based on the published Scheme (e.g., fixed business commission structure/calculation). Data-Driven Optimization: Utilize robust data analysis to monitor operational performance, reinforce the data culture, and provide actionable recommendations for process optimization. Qualifications: 1. Experience & Education Experience: Minimum of 1 year of proven experience in a practical, data-focused role (e.g., Operations Executive, Data Analyst, or Business Analyst). Sector Preference: Strong preference for candidates with experience in high-execution, data-intensive environments (e.g., E-commerce, Logistics, or E-wallet). Key Advantage: Prior experience in owning system configuration (Operational Admin) and executing reconciliation/risk control tasks (e.g., managing pricing tables). Education: Bachelor's degree or higher in Economics, Business Administration, Data Analytics, or a related field. 2. Core Skills & Mindset Operational & Control Mindset: Ability to exercise operational executive thinking, demonstrate process ownership , and maintain high accountability for data/configuration Accuracy . System Skills: Practical experience managing and performing system configuration (Admin tasks) on platforms like CRM or specialized Pricing Configuration/Admin tools. Core Integrity: High integrity and strong sense of data security , especially regarding sensitive pricing and business strategy information. Soft Skills: Excellent organizational and time management skills (adhering to Timeliness ). Strong communication and collaboration for cross-functional work. 3. Technical & Analytical Proficiency SQL: Proficiency in SQL query is mandatory. Excel: Advanced ability to use Excel for data extraction, reconciliation processing, and in-depth analysis. Bonus Skills: Experience with Python or Power BI Tools is a plus. Benefits: 13th-month salary, performance bonuses Health insurance, Social insurance, and Unemployment insurance Medical insurance Annual health checkup Annual salary review Internal and external training opportunities

The ideal candidate possesses advanced analytical skills and a strong command of data interpretation, with the ability to create compelling visualizations and transform complex data into actionable business frameworks. A detail-oriented mindset, strong organizational capabilities, and a high degree of self-motivation. Comfort navigating ambiguity and resolving conflicts through effective stakeholder engagement and cross-functional collaboration. Cultural agility and experience working across diverse teams. Excellent communication skills in English-verbal, written, and visual. Excellent influencing and negotiating skills are a plus. What Youâ€™ll Work On In this role, you will oversee factory supply performance for Always Available programs, mitigate risks, and drive operational excellence. You will collaborate across teams, leverage data analytics, and lead process improvements to ensure timely execution and deliver actionable insights for better business decisions. Monitor factory supply plans, production, capacity, and delivery performance for Always Available programs; assess risks and ensure smooth, on-time execution. Support decision-making to expedite resolutions and optimize marketplace coverage through effective order prioritization and excess raw material management. Coach and mentor factories to identify and implement opportunities for Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) optimization. Leverage data analytics and technical expertise to initiate and lead continuous process improvement projects. Transform complex data into actionable insights that drive better business decisions. Continuously learn and apply new skills (e.g., data analytics and visualization tools, presentation, and storytelling techniques).

job_description: About the Company At Pizza Hut Global, we want to build the Winning Recipe for our Customers and Team to connect people through the joy of pizza. PHG has a vast amount of Operational, financial and consumer data to surface insights for our Team and Key Markets to improve the Customer Experience, execution of standards, and to increase sales. About the Role Weâ€™re looking for someone with a proven track record to be our Data Analyst for the Business Operations Team who is passionate about leveraging data to solve business problems and make data-driven strategic decisions. This role is central to helping us size opportunities, measure the effectiveness of our strategic priorities, and ensure the choices we make are grounded in rigorous data and translate into clear business value. Data Modeling: Use historical data to create predictive models and correlation outcomes, helping to plan for KPI performance and make proactive decisions. Data Integration: Work closely with data teams to ensure seamless integration of data sources, ensuring that data flows accurately and efficiently between systems. Data Quality & Integrity: Maintain data accuracy, consistency, and integrity in data systems, identify discrepancies, and work to resolve any data issues promptly. Strong proficiency in Snowflake for data warehousing and querying. Expertise in DOMO and other BI-based for reporting, app-based dashboards, and data visualization. Proficiency in SQL, and experience with data analysis tools like Excel and Power BI. Familiarity with data modeling, ETL processes, and cloud-based data platforms. Strong understanding of statistical analysis and techniques. Experience working in a cross functional team. Ability to take data, turn it into insights and report back in clear concise format with recommendations for action. Strong organization and documentation skills. Relationship-building skills â€“ and ability to gain influence with key stakeholders in order to drive decisions. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Highly proactive and self motivated. Experience using Content Square or other user experience analysis tool advantageous. Pay range and compensation package 100% salary during the probation period 18 days of annual leave per year Five â€œRecharge Daysâ€ â€“ extra days in addition to company holidays One day of paid leave for your birthday Half-day Fridays Full salary insurance 13th-month bonus Advanced health insurance Regular team and engagement activities LinkedIn learning and training courses, based on company policy MacBook and monitors Pizza Hut, as a member of the Yum! Brands family recognizes the importance of having an inclusive culture with diverse team members and a steadfast commitment to developing a company culture where everyone feels respected. One of Pizza Hutâ€™s core values is to believe in all people, and we create environments where differences are sought out and celebrated.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: ABOUT THE COMPANY Publicis Groupe is a global leader in marketing, communication, and digital transformation services. Founded in 1926 and headquartered in Paris, France, it is one of the largest and most influential advertising and communications companies in the world. The Groupe is organized across four Solutions Hubs: Publicis Communications, Publicis Media, Publicis Sapient, and Publicis Health; to foster connectivity, integration, and collaboration across the organization. ABOUT THE ROLE We are seeking a skilled Data Intelligence Specialist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have strong data literacy, project management, and communication skills. This exciting role is part of a high-profile team working on cutting-edge solutions for major multinational clients. You should possess advanced data processing capabilities and technical expertise, with a solid understanding of digital media being a plus. Comfort in working with both technical and non-technical stakeholders is essential. RESPONSIBILITIES Data Literacy & Expertise Develop and Manage Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports using Looker Studio, Tableau, or Power BI, leveraging Google BigQuery for marketing data visualization. Data Transformation and Analysis: Load, clean, and transform large datasets in BigQuery to ensure accuracy for campaign tracking and performance measurement. Insights Generation: Analyze campaign performance and audience data to deliver actionable insights for marketing strategies and media optimization. Proposal and Report Building: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create data-driven proposals and presentations. SQL and Python Data Manipulation: Write optimized SQL queries and use Python for workflow automation and advanced analytics. Performance Optimization: Monitor and refine BigQuery workflows to improve efficiency and reduce costs. Data Governance and Compliance: Ensure compliance with privacy regulations and maintain data integrity and security. Project Management Participate in competitive intelligence roadmap discussions and prioritize analyses. Deliver customized reports, ad hoc analyses, and visualizations to support new business pitches. Manage multiple projects while maintaining process documentation and ensuring data accuracy. Apply an organized, detail-oriented, and QA-focused approach. Networking Build strong relationships with clients, vendors, and internal stakeholders. Manage client requirements, maintain SLAs & SOWs, and oversee team deliverables. Proactively identify opportunities to strengthen client relationships. QUALIFICATIONS Minimum 5 years of experience in data processing, ETL using SQL, and automation with Python. Proficiency in BI tools such as Looker Studio, Tableau, and Power BI. Hands-on experience with SQL, BigQuery, and Python; familiarity with GCP is a plus. Knowledge of JavaScript or TypeScript scripting is an advantage. Familiarity with media research tools (Netbase, Brandwatch, SimilarWeb, SemRush) preferred. Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills (pivot tables, charts, dashboards). Basic understanding of statistical analysis and research. Familiarity with media performance analytics and reporting is a plus. Highly organized, self-motivated, and able to manage multiple priorities. WHY JOINING US? At Publicis Groupe, youâ€™ll work with some of the worldâ€™s biggest brands, collaborate with talented teams, and be part of a culture that values innovation, growth, and impact.

job_description: Location: Ho Chi Minh, Vietnam Company: TC Data Type: Full-time About Us TC Data is a fast-growing provider of Data & AI services , specializing in Microsoft Fabric, Azure, Power BI, and Machine Learning solutions . We help businesses unlock business insights through innovative Data Lakehouse, BI, and AI technologies. Role Overview We are looking for a Data Scientist who is passionate about applying machine learning to solve real-world business problems such as sales forecasting, demand prediction, and optimization modeling . This role will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy advanced analytics models that drive tangible business outcomes. Key Responsibilities Develop predictive models for business use cases such as Sales Forecasting, Demand Planning, Inventory Optimization, etc. Design optimization algorithms to improve resource allocation, pricing strategies, and operational efficiency. Perform data preprocessing and feature engineering on structured and unstructured datasets. Deploy and monitor machine learning models in production environments (using Azure Machine Learning or similar platforms). Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements, define success criteria, and translate them into analytical solutions. Communicate insights and model results to both technical and non-technical audiences through reports, dashboards, or presentations. Continuously research and experiment with new techniques to enhance model performance and reliability. Requirements Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related fields. 2+ years of practical experience building machine learning models for business applications (especially time-series forecasting and optimization problems). Solid understanding of Supervised Learning, Time Series Modeling (ARIMA, Prophet, LSTM, etc.), Optimization Techniques (Linear Programming, Heuristic Methods, etc.). Hands-on experience with Python, SQL, and machine learning frameworks (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch). Experience working with Azure Machine Learning, Databricks, or other cloud-based ML platforms is a strong plus. Familiarity with MLOps practices and deployment techniques is a bonus. Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and business acumen. Preferred Qualifications Experience with sales forecasting models or inventory/demand optimization projects. Experience integrating models with Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, or similar BI tools. Knowledge of model explainability techniques (e.g., SHAP, LIME) to build trust with business users. Understanding of data engineering concepts (ETL/ELT pipelines) is a plus. Why Join TC Data? Work on real-world, high-impact Data & AI projects. Opportunity to innovate and lead AI-driven initiatives for top enterprise clients. Competitive salary and performance-based bonus. Professional training and certifications supported (Microsoft Azure AI, Machine Learning, etc.). A collaborative, agile, and innovation-driven work culture. How to Apply Please send your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and expertise to hr@tcdata.vn.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Business Planning Manager to drive our omnichannel (online and offline) commercial forecasting and promotion strategies. This pivotal role involves collaborating with key stakeholders to define strategic priorities, identify key growth drivers, and ensure seamless implementation across all channels. You will be instrumental in optimizing our sales performance, enhancing customer-centric forecasting, and ensuring our commercial plans are robust, agile, and aligned with market trends. Key Responsibilities Strategic Omnichannel Business Planning & Forecasting: Lead and embed comprehensive business planning processes across both online and offline (O+O) channels. Drive multi-functional collaboration for accurate monthly and yearly commercial forecast cycles, ensuring data integrity and reliability. Customer-Centric Forecasting & Value Generation: Champion a customer-centric approach to forecasting by developing precise customer-level unit forecasts and diagnosing value opportunities to maximize commercial impact. Promotional & Sales Initiative Management: Consolidate and manage promotional plans and forecasts (units and investment), ensuring they are consistently updated and accurate. Evaluate the impact of sales initiatives (SITs), accounting for cannibalization and seasonality, and foster strong collaboration with customers for promotional alignment. Risk Mitigation & Trend Alignment: Proactively identify and assess potential risks and opportunities within the commercial forecasts. Ensure forecast consistency with broader market trends and actively work to close any identified gaps to maintain robust planning. Performance Analytics & Optimization: Lead commercial analytics, forecasting, and reporting efforts. Monitor key omnichannel performance indicators (KPIs), analyze sales and customer data, and translate complex insights into actionable strategies for performance optimization and conversion improvement. Cross-functional Strategic Alignment: Drive alignment and foster strong collaboration with Key Account Managers (KAMs), Supply Chain, and Finance teams to optimize sales planning processes ("The Way We Plan"). Strategically challenge and develop longer-term forecasts to support sustainable growth. Market & Competitive Intelligence: Conduct thorough market research, competitive benchmarking, and trend analysis within the dynamic beauty industry. Leverage insights to inform strategic decision-making and uncover new business opportunities. Key Requirements & Experiences Experience: Minimum of 4 years of progressive experience in Sales, Trade Marketing, Business Planning, Retail, or Channel Development, ideally within the FMCG sector. Experience in the Beauty category is a significant advantage. Strategic & Analytical Acumen: Possess strong strategic thinking capabilities coupled with exceptional data analytical skills, demonstrating a proven ability to make data-driven business decisions. Commercial & Entrepreneurial Mindset: Exhibit a robust commercial and entrepreneurial drive, consistently focused on results, solution-oriented, and capable of acting with urgency. Growth Mindset & Agility: Demonstrate a growth-oriented approach, high adaptability, and a willingness to go above and beyond to achieve objectives. Communication & Negotiation: Excellent communication and negotiation skills, capable of articulating complex information clearly and influencing diverse stakeholders effectively. Execution & Resilience: Proven ability to multitask efficiently, deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines, and perform effectively under pressure. Collaboration & Leadership: Adept at both individual contribution and fostering strong teamwork, particularly in cross-functional environments. Experienced in managing and influencing key senior stakeholders. Language: Fluency in English (written and spoken) is essential. Technical Proficiency: Advanced proficiency in MS Office Applications (Excel, PowerPoint) and Power BI (a mandatory requirement).

job_title: Senior Associate - Business Performance Analyst/ S&OP/ Business Operations
company: SABECO - Saigon Beer Alcohol Beverage Corporation
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Role Purpose Support outlet investment performance through data analysis, reporting, and digital tools. Ensure accurate tracking, timely insights, and collaboration to drive profitable decisions. Key Responsibilities Business Analysis & Performance Insight Monitor outlet sales performance before/after investment. Analyze investment effectiveness (volume uplift, spend per litre, outlet productivity). Identify underperforming investments and opportunity areas using data analytics. Prepare monthly investment performance reports for management. Investment Execution & Tracking Ensure all investment requests are submitted through digital platforms. Update investment status, contracts, and budget tracking in DMS/SFA/CMS Ensure accuracy of investment data in systems. Digitalization & System Support Assist BI/IT teams to enhance tools for investment tracking (DMS, SFA, CMS dashboards). Support creation of automated dashboards and test new features before rollout. Train sales teams on basic usage of updated digital tools and support capability building. Sales Support & Collaboration Provide data-driven recommendations to Sales Supervisors/ASM on outlet investment choices. Support territory planning, outlet segmentation updates, and performance diagnosis. Work closely with Sales, Finance, Trade Marketing, and Digital/IT teams. Competencies Analytical skills & numerical accuracy Business acumen Data visualization Planning & prioritization Communication & stakeholder management Project management (for digitalization tasks) Qualifications Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Data Analytics, or related fields. 2â€“3 years experience in FMCG sales analysis, commercial support, trade investment, or BI/reporting. Strong Excel/Google Sheets, experience with dashboards (Power BI). Familiarity with DMS/SFA/CMS systems a strong plus. Analytical mindset with good commercial understanding. Detail-oriented, structured, and able to work cross-functionally. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) Investment KPIs Accuracy of investment tracking & reporting â€“ Ensures financial compliance and prevents revenue leakage Timeliness of investment data updates â€“ Improves decision-making speed % of proposals aligned with financial guardrails â€“ Maintains profitability and cost control Incremental volume analysis accuracy â€“ Supports accurate ROI evaluation Digitalization KPIs Number of automated reports/dashboard delivered â€“ Enhances efficiency and reduces manual work DMS/SFA/CMS data accuracy rate â€“ Improves reliability of sales execution Sales team adoption rate of new digital features â€“ Accelerates digital transformation Reduction in manual reporting time â€“ Frees up resources for value-added tasks Assist managers in capability building by sharing best practices and guiding peers on investment tracking and reporting. Coaching KPIs Monthly conducted a training session for sales operation â€“ Improves capability and knowledge sharing. Sales operation competency improvement score (post-training) â€“ Enhances decision-making and execution quality. Adoption rate of coached practices (%) â€“ Accelerates digital adoption and process compliance.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Key Responsibilities Strategic Planning & Business Management: Develop and implement short-term and long-term strategic plans to position the product and meet key business goals (sales, profit, market share). Manage the Advertising & Promotion (A&P) budget and monitor product expenditure in alignment with approved plans. Market Analysis & Product Development: Conduct market analysis, competitive assessments, and customer research to shape product strategy. Manage the product life cycle, including new product launches, line extensions, and optimization of branding and pricing strategies. Facilitate market intelligence strategies and prepare competitive countermeasures. Integrated Marketing & Communications: Design and execute integrated advertising, promotional, and communication campaigns. Build and maintain close relationships with key customers to enhance brand equity. Sales Support & Training: Forecast sales and provide tactical support, promotional materials, and training (product knowledge, objection handling) to the field force to ensure sales targets are achieved. Operations & Compliance: Coordinate with Logistics/Operations to ensure timely product availability and manage administrative requirements. Liaise with the Regulatory Department to monitor product registration/visa status and ensure all business activities comply with company and industry codes of conduct. Candidate Requirements: Bachelorâ€™s degree in Marketing or Pharmacy. A minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role within the Pharmaceutical Industry is mandatory. Highly motivated with a strong results-oriented drive; possesses creativity, professionalism, enthusiasm, and a strong teamwork spirit. Must demonstrate reliability, excellent communication skills, independence, confidence, and the ability to effectively work under pressure. location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Responsibilities Governance: Establish the PMO role and create a Center of Excellence in alignment with Project Management Institute (PMI) guidelines, quality standards and company requirements. Seek implementation efficiencies to meet or exceed the financial expectations established at project initiation. Develop, implement, and govern program management processes, tools, templates, policies and metrics. Monitor compliance with project policies and standards. Develop and Deliver Project Management Training Develop training materials, such as manuals, guides and training videos for project management methodology, Microsoft Project Online, and Project Management Power BI Dashboards training. Provide training and guidance to the project teams and other PMO stakeholders on project management methodology, governance, best practices and the use of templates, standard reports and tools. Provide Project Management Reporting and Compliance Define requirements, design, develop and maintain reports and dashboards with general project information, project status and compliance. Monitor and analyze project progress and compliance, and proactively advise management of deviations, risks and issues. Engage with project stakeholders to discuss status of new and ongoing projects and provide updates of risks and issues; discuss and follow up on the agreed risk mitigation and issue resolution; provide project assurance. Design surveys, undertake data collection, analyze information, and produce reports outlining problems, conclusions and trends. Profile Masterâ€™s degree in Business Administration, or related field required. A first-level university degree in combination with additional two (2) years of qualifying experience may be accepted in lieu of the advanced university degree. A minimum of 10 years of project management experience preferred. Expertâ€level knowledge of project and change management, methodologies, techniques, processes (e.g., Project and Portfolio Management Methodology â€“ PPM). Budget, cost and profitability management skills. Knowledge of resource management tools. Ability to influence without authority. Flexible, adaptable and resourceful when managing changing timelines and multiple deliverables. Demonstrated leadership ability to establish and manage a highâ€performance team. Motivated to build relationships at executive levels with technology, solutions, customers and vendor groups. Working experience with MS Project Online, MS PowerBI. Project management certification such as PRINCE2 Practitioner or PMP. Experience engaging with client customers at diverse levels, from senior management to junior level personnel.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Job Title: Assistant Finance Manager (Customer Development Team) Posting Start Date: 15/12/2025 Req ID: 1401 Job Summary The Customer Development Finance Manager is responsible for managing and controlling monthly sales expenses while ensuring accurate financial records and reporting. This role includes conducting variance analysis, maintaining a centralized data dashboard for commercial expenses, and implementing validation procedures for sales-related documents. Ideal candidates should possess a strong understanding of finance principles, familiarity with the FMCG market, and practical knowledge of data analytics tools such as Power BI. Job Responsibilities Collaborate with the business partners and management accounting team (BBF) to control monthly landing of sales expense, including Salesforce, Trading Terms, Visibility, Trade Promotion, Discounts and other commercial activities initiated by Sales or Trade Marketing team Perform closing tasks for Salesforce, Trading Terms, Visibility, Trade Promotion, Discounts and other commercial activities to ensure accurate financial records and reporting. Include pertinent review, control of commercial proposal in terms of accounting impacts, develop efficient closing processes to meet both financial and management accounting timeline. Conduct variance analysis to identify discrepancies between planned budgets and actual results for Salesforce, Trading Terms, and Visibility. Design and maintain a centralized data repository or dashboard for commercial expenses, combining with non-financial data and ratios for commercial analysis Implement robust validation procedures for payment and reimbursement documents associated with sales expenses. Establish strict documentation requirements and approval matrices to ensure data accuracy and control. Prepare sales reports, including monthly rolling forecast (MUF). Ensure that the reports are submitted within deadlines and maintain a high level of accuracy. Ensure proper explanation and documentation of tax and auditing-related documents and details pertaining to promotion costs, display costs, discount costs, trade terms, and indirect sales. Other ad-hoc analysis, including building business case or Channel P&L as assigned by superior. Other Requirements Solid understanding of finance and accounting principles, with experience in controlling cost and Familiarity with the FMCG market and experience working in large multinational companies. Practical knowledge with Power BI, Power Query or other data analytics tool Job Responsibilities - Continued Skills Business English MS Office Accounting systems knowledge (Oracle, SAP) Functional Competencies Planning Management reporting and analysis Cost accounting and management Risk management and internal control Masan's Core Competencies Consumer Centricity Innovation Ownership Passion for winning Purposeful Leadership Masan's Leadership Competencies Business Acumen Learning Agility Dealing With Ambiguity Vision & Strategy Talent Catalyst Leading The Change Integrity & Trust Stakeholder Management Collaboration Planning Problem Solving Result Driven Education Bachelors in Finance or Accounting Certifications Conditions of Employment Physical Requirements Relevant Industries Interview Questions

job_title: (Senior) Business Intelligence Analyst - FP&A (Performance Control) - Shopee
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About The Team Join Shopeeâ€™s Business Intelligence - FP&A team to drive commercial and Profit & Loss (P&L) impact through deep analytics, scenario modeling, and cross-functional influence. Youâ€™ll partner with diverse stakeholders across Business Development, Seller Management, Marketing, Finance, and Operations to shape decisions on revenue growth and cost efficiency in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment. Job Description Own complex SQL analytics: Write complex and high-performance SQL, and build pipelines that power decision-making. Lead Commercial & P&L scenario modeling: Simulate Commercial & P&L outcomes, quantify trade-offs, and recommend actions with clear P&L impact. Influence stakeholders: Translate data into actionable narratives; drive alignment and decisions across Business Development/Seller teams/Marketing/Finance; facilitate reviews and defend recommendations with evidence. Spot and size opportunities: Identify revenue levers, cost optimizations, and operational efficiencies; estimate impact and risks. Operate under pressure: Manage competing priorities, deliver to tight timelines, and maintain analytical quality and accuracy. Build decision tools: Create dashboards and reports to empower stakeholders with actionable insights. Uphold data quality: Define metrics, validate logic, and ensure traceability from raw data to final insights Requirements 3+ years in Business Intelligence / Analytics with advanced SQL. Strong Excel skills. Clear communication in English and Vietnamese - able to craft concise memos and present to cross-functional leads. Resilience and execution under high pressure with strong prioritization and ownerships E-commerce domain knowledge (seller segments, pricing, promotions, ads, logistics costs). Experience with Python/R for data wrangling, forecasting, or experiment analysis.
