job_title: Vietnam Ice Cream Customer Strategy & Planning Lead
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Job Descriptions Synergize/translate brand strategic directions and category marketing plans to customer/channel opportunities. Work jointly with marketing to match brandsâ€™ strategic objectives with customer/ market needs, analyze competitions and market landscape. Own S&OP input-output, manage and drive business performance in short term and long term. Lead sales gap-closure activities and optimization. Ensure brand volume and value growth in priority channels and customers Manage holistic customer/ channel investment for category opportunities (shopper marketing, trade marketing, in-store). Identify trade spending opportunities and allocate budget based on category priority and business needs. Collaborate closely with channel team in developing the category-channel strategy, shopper promotion and POSM alignment. Understand dynamic market situation and adapt trade strategies and plans on regional basis Job Requirements 5+ years of experience in category management/ channel/ trade marketing, preferrable within FMCG industry. Ability to work with people across various functions and levels. Strong negotiation skills to work with Field sales team. Strong analytical skills, organizational skills and business mind set. Strong in leadership and ability to coach a team. Proactive, confident, initiative and able to work with multiple priorities. Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications, particularly working skill in Excel Power BI knowledge will be an advantage. Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their â€˜Whole Selfâ€™ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About Dat Bike Dat Bike is a technology startup whose mission is to drive mass adoption of green transportation. We make the most compelling and dependable electric bikes so that customers can just switch without making any compromises. To do this, we welcome the brightest people to join our journey. Dat Bike team consists of young, ambitious people who are result driven. We want to grow Dat Bike to become a giant in the world. Join us if you want to make something great, from scratch! Responsibilities: Develop and implement sales policies: Design, implement, and continuously improve sales policies to ensure consistency, efficiency, and compliance across all sales operations. Sales process optimization: Identify inefficiencies in sales processes and implement solutions to improve speed, accuracy, and productivity. Standardize workflows to enhance team efficiency. CRM & system management: Maintain, optimize, and enhance the CRM system, ensuring data accuracy, usability, and integration with other tools. Provide support to the sales team for CRM-related issues and improvements. Process management: Develop, document, and refine standard operating procedures (SOPs) for sales operations. Ensure consistency and scalability of sales processes. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Data Analytics, or a related field. 2+ years of experience in sales operations, CRM management, or process optimization roles. Strong analytical skills with proficiency in Excel, Google Sheets, and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). Hands-on experience with CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, or equivalent) and sales process automation. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and stakeholder management abilities. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities. Location: Dat Bike Factory, Lot II-1, Road No. 1, CN2 Group, Tan Binh Industrial Park, Tay Thanh Ward, Ho Chi Minh City

location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
job_description: JOB DESCRIPTION: Creates and maintains Master Data records in Global MDM tool and in various OpCos systems in accordance with HEINEKEN process standards, data standards, policies and objectives. Supports data cleansing initiatives, serves as data standards expert. Participate in building and maintaining datasets for reporting and analytics purposes. Document metadata, data models, and governance processes. Assist in developing and enhancing Data Management Application adoption and Data Quality improvement use case and perform monitoring activities. JOB REQUIREMENTS: SQL and data modeling concepts are must Familiarity with ERP, MDM, cloud platforms, especially Synapse, ADF, Databricks, is a plus. Exposure to any Data Tool (Power BI preferred) is a bonus. Communication and problem-solving skills. Willingness to learn new tools and technologies in a fast-paced environment.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Yes4All is one of the leading brands for home sporting goods & furniture in the e-commerce market. Founded in 2010, we have strived to be the world leader in e-commerce enablers in term of trading, product creating and e-commerce servicing. Based in California with an operation office in HCMC, we have more than 500 young and talented members with expert knowledge and experience in the e-commerce industry. We are on an ambitious journey to dominate not only US e-commerce market but also to enter new e-commerce markets of more than 15 countries in Europe, Asia and North America, not only Amazon channel but also Walmart, Wayfair among others. Besides, home sporting goods, furniture, outdoor and gardening are also great opportunities that we desire to occupy and create significant values. With our steady knowledge in E-commerce, Yes4All started to provide end-to-end ecommerce-enabler service in order to help Vietnamese and global manufacturers or struggling sellers bring their products to the US & International markets. Our mission: Connect the Worldwide Resources & create innovative platform to bring products and services from innovators and manufacturers to worldwide customers more efficiently. Our vision: To be the world leader of e-commerce enabler in term of trading, product creating, and e-commerce servicing. I. JOB DECRIPTIONS Product Strategy & Vision: Define and communicate the product vision and roadmap for internal supply chain applications. Ensure alignment with organizational goals and operational needs. Internal stakeholder collaboration: Act as the primary point of contact between business units, engineering, and design teams. Gather and prioritize requirements from internal stakeholders, including supply chain, operations, and finance teams. Facilitate regular communication to ensure alignment and transparency across all functions. Product Development & Delivery: Lead the development and deployment of internal applications, focusing on improving efficiency, scalability, and user experience. Partner with engineering teams to ensure timely delivery of high-quality software solutions. Cross-Functional Coordination: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify process improvements and design solutions that streamline internal operations. Work closely with IT and infrastructure teams to ensure system compatibility and data integrity. Performance Monitoring & Continuous Improvement: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and effectiveness of internal applications. Regularly review and optimize applications based on user feedback and performance data. Ii. Requirements Experience: Minimum 5+ years of product management experience, preferably in developing internal tools or supply chain software. Proven track record of working with cross-functional teams to deliver impactful solutions for internal stakeholders. Technical Expertise: Strong understanding of software development processes, including Agile methodologies. Familiarity with supply chain systems such as ERP, WMS, TMS, and other internal tools used for operations management. Skills: Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with diverse teams. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to identify and address operational challenges. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment. Education: Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field. MBA or advanced degree is a plus. Familiarity with data integration and reporting tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or SQL. Certifications in product management (e.g., Certified Scrum Product Owner, Pragmatic Institute certifications). III. WHY YOU WILL LOVE JOINING US? FOR YOU TO JOIN Financial Well-being: A competitive salary with 13th month salary, annual performance bonus and a variety of allowances. Salary review: annually or on excellent performance. Activities: company trips, team-building, and other customized monthly bonding events. Annual leaves: 16 days off and 01 Birthday Leave per year. Healthcare: annual health check, insurance according to Labor Law and extra PTI Insurance package. Working Environment: dynamic, friendly environments with working time flexibility, and other perks include snacks, coffee, and healthy food provided daily suited for hardworking, fun, and team collaboration. FOR YOU TO GROW Ambition: We are now keeping on with our hyper growth to multicategory, multichannel, multimarket, and expanding into the world largest e-commerce enabler. Hence, there will continuously be opportunities to challenge yourself, learn new skills and knowledge. Challenges: Your voice can always be heard as we embrace the eagerness of learning and sharing. You can be your own boss and create your own value with the ability to take initiative and make decisions in all aspects of work. Chances: Be led and coached by experienced and inspirational leaders and participate in various training courses where you can enlarge your knowledge and experience in the E-commerce and Supply Chain industry. FOR YOU TO STAY People: Having a headquarter in the US and an operation office in Vietnam, our team is young and highly motivated. You will be working with and alongside members having experiences from International Corporations or high profile from Vietnam that share the same passion and dedication. Culture: Our working environment is humble, collaborative and 100% healthy. We promote Exchange & Speak out, you can receive transparent and supportive feedback so you can perform the best. Career path: Provide you with a great career path, open to rotating for your better understanding of the company and contribute across many of our functions. And much more, join us and let yourself explore other fantastic things!

job_title: Microsoft Power Platform Developer - Sign-on Bonus
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: We are seeking a Microsoft Power Platform Developer to join our team and lead the design, development, and customization of business solutions within the Microsoft 365 ecosystem. This role is perfect for someone who enjoys solving problems, automating processes, and turning business needs into user-friendly apps - even if your background is in analysis , project management , or ge neral IT . You'll work with tools like Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and SharePoint Online to create modern solutions that make work easier and more efficient. Locations: Ho Chi Minh, Da Nang, Hanoi What You'll Be Doing Building modern business applications using Microsoft technologies including Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Dataverse Creating custom connectors and seamless integrations across Microsoft 365 services and third-party platforms Designing and customizing business solutions in SharePoint Online and integrate them with Power Platform tools Collaborating with stakeholders and product owners to translate business needs into secure, intuitive, and maintainable digital solutions Preparing comprehensive technical documentation, user guides, and delivering training and knowledge-sharing sessions to support team enablement Staying current with the latest advancements in Microsoft 365 technologies and continuously expanding technical skill sets Requirements Must have 3+ years of experience in designing and developing business applications using Power Platform Proficient with Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Power Pages and Dataverse Experience with Microsoft Copilot Studio for building intelligent, AI-assisted workflows or chatbots Knowledge of relational databases (e.g., SQL Server), including data modeling, queries Experience working in Agile/Scrum teams and collaborating with cross-functional roles Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Nice to have Experience with Microsoft Teams integration Familiarity with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and other Microsoft 365 applications Familiarity with SharePoint Online, Dataverse, and Microsoft 365 integrations Experienced in sharing knowledge and training team members Prior experience in roles such as Business Analyst, Project Manager, or IT Support, with interest in transitioning to low-code development Benefits Three days remote every week and four full remote weeks per year Gold level Health Insurance coverage from Bao Viet Insurance, a yearly complete Health Check and social insurance All office benefits and full salary during probation Flexible working time starting anytime up to 10 AM working Monday - Friday with no overtime and a long lunch break Unlimited snacks and nice coffee every day Choose from a brand-new Mac or PC device Salary review twice a year with opportunities for promotions and spot awards 12 days annual leave per year, with all days not taken paid out in cash, plus 2 sick leave days. Yearly Training Budget up to 5 million VND per staff. On top of that, Professional coaching program, buddy system, tech talks, agile sessions, and 1on1 private English classes are available Yearly company trip, monthly activities, , and other Celebrations for special days in the year, such as Women's Day, YEP, and Christmas Employee-led clubs within the company; games teams, sports teams, etc Modern open-space office with comfortable workspace, a PS4 games room, and chill-out areas

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Trusting Social is an AI Fintech pioneer that's revolutionizing credit access in emerging markets. Our mission is "Advancing AI to Meet the Financial Needs of Everyday Consumers with Empathy." We've assessed over 1 billion consumers across four countries, and we're on a mission to provide 100 million credit lines using the power of AI and Big Data. Are you a dedicated and curious Senior Data Analyst ready to dive deep into data and drive impactful business decisions? We're looking for a proactive individual to join our dynamic team in Vietnam. If you're passionate about uncovering insights, solving complex problems, and contributing directly to operational excellence and product development in a company with a strong social mission, this role is for you! How You'll Make An Impact As a Senior Data Analyst at Trusting Social, you'll be at the core of our data-driven decision-making process. You'll analyze and interpret complex datasets to provide actionable insights that directly influence our strategic direction, product enhancements, and operational efficiency. Your work will not only improve our internal processes but also contribute directly to democratizing credit access for millions in emerging markets. What You'll Do Develop & Maintain Analytics Tools: Assist in the creation and upkeep of essential reports, dashboards, and analytical tools that empower sound business decisions. Conduct In-Depth Analysis: Perform thorough data analyses focused on practical problems that drive significant business improvements. Innovate Infrastructure: Support the maintenance and innovation of our analyst infrastructure, including code bases and business intelligence tools. Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with various departments to enhance workflows and boost overall organizational efficiency. Strengthen Our Team: Participate in talent acquisition and management efforts to help build and strengthen our analytics capabilities. What We're Looking For We need a proactive, insightful, and technically skilled Senior Data Analyst who can turn data into action: Insight Generation: You're exceptional at asking the right questions that lead to actionable business insights. Analytical Prowess: Strong skills in conducting thorough analyses, whether through data analysis, market research, or effective cross-team communication. Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in SQL and Python for data querying and manipulation. Critical Thinking: An aptitude for critically evaluating data outcomes, uncovering key insights, and challenging assumptions. Tech Adaptability: A keen interest and proven ability to leverage new technologies to enhance work quality and productivity. Industry Experience: A proven track record in banking, fintech, or retail business intelligence teams is highly advantageous. What We Offer Join our vibrant team and enjoy: Competitive compensation, including 13th-month salary and performance bonuses. Comprehensive health care for you and your dependents. Generous leave policies and flexible work hours. Convenient District 1 office location (next to a future metro station). Onsite lunch with multiple options. Grab for work allowance and fully equipped workstations. Fun team-building activities, sponsored sports clubs, and Thursday happy hours. Unlimited free coffee, tea, snacks, and fruit. A chance to make a profound social impact by democratizing credit access in emerging markets. At Trusting Social, we live by ownership, integrity, and agility in execution. We believe in doing what's right, what's best, and what's innovative. If you're smart, driven, and want to make a difference in the world with the most advanced and fascinating technology, we invite you to be part of our rockstar team! For more information about us, please visit our website: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=inAEDGvOcL8&t=29s

location: Ho Chi Minh City Metropolitan Area
job_description: Company Overview: At Hoang An Nhien, we are on a mission to lead a great lifestyle in Southeast Asia. As a leader in the nightlife industry in Vietnam with over 4,000 people, we are well on our way to achieving our vision of becoming the leading lifestyle company in the region. Hoang An Nhien is developing into an ecosystem including nightlife and F&B to provide the best services and bring great experiences to customers. We are looking for outstanding people with a strong growth mindset to join us on this exciting journey. Main Responsibilities: Assist in preparing annual budgets and financial plans. Act in a financial controlling role, ensuring expenditures remain within the approved budget. Develop financial models to solve business issues. Analyze financial data to identify trends, variances, and opportunities for improvement. Communicate with cross-functional teams to understand trends, gather commercial insights, and provide recommendations for sales performance improvement and accurate forecasting. Prepare daily and monthly reports on time. Support the monthly financial reporting process, including collecting and reconciling data from diverse sources. Assist in building the organization's database, including sales data and financial figures. Perform other tasks and ad-hoc analyses as assigned by the Head/Line Manager. Requirements: Bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field. 2â€“4 years of experience in financial planning and analysis; experience in the F&B or nightlife industry is an advantage. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; additional skills such as Power Query and Power BI are a plus. Strong knowledge of accounting principles and a solid understanding of financial statements. Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-growing environment. Strong attention to detail with a careful and curious mindset. What we can offer you: Join one of Vietnam's largest and most prestigious companies in the lifestyle sector. Work with a young, dynamic, and creative team. 13th month salary guaranteed. Benefit from annual performance reviews. Discover even more exciting perks and opportunities by joining us!

job_title: [SPX Express] Senior Associate, Business Product Management
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About the Team: Our SPX Express Product Team is currently seeking a dynamic and experienced Product Manager to join our team and spearhead our digital transformation efforts. Our vision is to create a seamless and efficient supply chain ecosystem that empowers businesses and delights customers. We aim to leverage cutting-edge technologies and data-driven insights to optimize operations, enhance visibility, and deliver exceptional value to our clients. As a Product Manager, you will have the opportunity to analyze complex business challenges, generate creative product ideas, and deliver exceptional value to both internal and external customers. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and execute product strategies that align with our mission of transforming the logistics landscape. Join our Operation Squad, where youâ€™ll shape the heart of SPXâ€™s logistics operation â€” driving innovations that make parcel delivery faster, cheaper, and more reliable . Youâ€™ll work cross-functionally to optimize cost, lead time, and service quality through data-driven insights and product execution . This is a high-impact role for builders who thrive in operational complexity and want to redefine customer experience at scale Job Description: Product Discovery: Engage with both internal and external customers to understand their pain points and challenges. Conduct thorough market research to identify areas for improvement and potential opportunities. Analyze and extract relevant information from large datasets, both structured and unstructured, to streamline and enhance critical processes. Independently define business problems and propose solution approaches with minimal guidance. Scrutinize and validate data to ensure its quality and reliability, generating actionable insights. Collaborate with data teams to enhance data assets, quality, metrics, and insights. Utilize robust data analysis skills to systematically prioritize customer requirements. Develop comprehensive product roadmaps for relevant components on a yearly, monthly, and weekly basis. Product Delivery: Propose business solutions from a product perspective to address customer needs. Offer creative and feasible technical solutions to meet customer requirements. Craft concise documents and utilize data visualization techniques to effectively communicate results to stakeholders and facilitate decision-making. Coordinate with the regional team throughout the product development process. Collaborate with the Product Support team to provide support to end users. Oversee projects to successfully deploy features for all customers. Measure the business impact of released features and gather feedback. Effectively manage the product lifecycle, ensuring continuous improvement and alignment with business objectives. Requirement: Must have: Creative & Proactive: Curious and proactive in seeking insights and addressing market opportunities with critical thinking. Business Acumen: Prioritizes long-term business outcomes, skillful in product prioritization, and effective in stakeholder communication. Functional skills: Strong technical understanding and ability to analyze data effectively. Better to have: Previous work experience as a business analyst or product manager Experience working with data/product teams Understanding of Business flow, Data flow, UX flow, UI Design, API, Project Management.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: About the Role: Define and build your institutional / high-net worth clientele - in the fast-growing crypto & blockchain industry, there are no limits to who your clients are (or could potentially be)! You take ownership & lead in flexibly identifying & pitching institutional leads. Take pride in successes that could come in various shapes - from onboarding a client to their first crypto instrument, to customizing a crypto product for your client that the market has never seen before. Craft and tailor your products - the journey of bringing traditional financial services products to crypto has just begun, you have a say in tailoring what you pitch to institutional clients. You are encouraged to put your creativity & expertise to full use: identify other financial services offerings that may be of interest (e.g., credit, custody) - and you will have the full support of the Crypto.com team to bring a new product into fruition! Responsibilities: Identifying and reaching out to institutional client leads; Understanding client needs and pitching relevant Crypto.com products such as market maker/taker programs, OTC, custody and staking Attend Conferences, represent Crypto.com engaging with institutional players, increasing awareness of our institutional business products and services Conducting community reach activities, attend crypto community gatherings, meetings to expand and deepen our institutional footprint Researching on market & competitor trends in the crypto institutional space; Drafting and closing client or partnership agreements; Proposing new crypto institutional offerings; Maintaining ongoing contact with institutional clients, keeping track of client feedback, and recommending product improvements What KPIs we track: Number of new clients onboarded Volume of client transactions Revenue & profit generated Requirements: 3+ years of experience in Institutional Outbound Sales 1+ years experience in digital assets/cryptocurrency/web3 in outbound sales - Exchange/Custodian/Prime Broker Familiarity with institutional products such as market maker/taker programs, OTC, custody and staking Network/book of clients in the cryptocurrency space that should include cryptocurrency hedge funds, proprietary trading firms, HFT, banks, asset managers, OTC desks, as well as clients seeking custody solutions Candidates with more experience would be considered for a Senior Institutional Sales Position Demonstrable track record of initiating, managing & monetizing relationships with clients or partners, e.g., examples of acquiring institutional clients, driving business results with clients & partners, drafting documentations & agreements; Excellent command of professional written & oral English, writing & presentation samples are welcome Proficiency in English We may use artificial intelligence tools to analyze the content of your Resume/CV against the specific requirements for the position. The purpose is to support our recruitment team in reviewing applications more effectively. These tools assist our recruitment team in their evaluation of your application by providing recommendations, but they do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans who consider the insights generated by the tools along with other relevant information. If you would like more details about how your personal information is processed, please contact us.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Data Scientist Company: AnyWork's Client (product) Working type: Hybrid Working location: Dist.1, HCMC Working hours: Mon-Fri Salary: Negotiable SHUI: full salary English: Fluent Job overview and responsibility Key Responsibilities - Design and deploy AI/ML pipelines to automate finance processes (close, reconciliation, forecasting, tax analytics). - Develop agentic AI systems (multi-agent workflows with CrewAI, AutoGen, LangGraph, or similar). - Integrate AI solutions with enterprise platforms (ERP, BI tools, Dataiku, Google Vertex AI, Azure OpenAI). - Build supervised/unsupervised ML models (forecasting, anomaly detection, fraud/risk analysis). - Fine-tune LLMs on finance datasets with strict compliance and governance controls. - Implement monitoring, retraining, and performance management frameworks for models. - Translate finance workflows into measurable AI use-cases with ROI (e.g., >20% time savings, >30% accuracy uplift). - Deliver pilots in <90 days and scale to enterprise level within 6â€“12 months. - Work closely with process owners to ensure adoption and governance. - Ensure AI solutions meet audit, data privacy, and regulatory requirements. - Build explainability and traceability into deployed models. Required skills and experiences - 4â€“7 years in data science / ML engineering with proven production deployments. - Exposure to finance/accounting processes (forecasting, close, compliance, treasury). - Hands-on experience with AI factory models: modular design, reusable components, orchestration frameworks. - Previous work in a shared services or multinational finance organization. - Proficient in Python (pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch/TensorFlow), SQL, APIs. - Experience with agentic AI frameworks: CrewAI, AutoGen, LangChain, LangGraph, or similar. - Cloud deployment skills: Google Vertex AI, Azure ML, AWS Sagemaker, or equivalent. - Strong track record in delivering business productivity projects with measurable ROI. - Fluent English skills Preferred skills and experiences - Familiarity with Dataiku DSS or similar low-code AI factory platforms. - Experience with workflow automation (Power Automate, UiPath, n8n). Why Candidate should apply this position The company is one of Asia's largest defense and engineering groups. It has also diversified over the years, and now supplies both military customers and commercial ones in over 100 countries, which cover its four core businesses -- aerospace, land systems, electronics and marine. - Meal allowance & transportation allowance - Laptop - 100% salary from probation - Training from probation - Free learning of all courses on LinkedIn e-learning - Private insurance for employees from probation - SHUI is paid on total Gross Base salary - Annual performance review - Annual salary review - Lots of periodic company gatherings and events. Report to Head of Finance Transformation / FP&A Lead Interview process 1-2 round of interviews with Hiring Manager

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Company Description CMC Global, a member of CMC Corporation, has been a leader in the IT and digital solutions industry since its founding in March 2017. With a mission to empower businesses worldwide, CMC Global focuses on innovative technologies that drive digital transformation and create significant impacts across industries. The company maintains a strong presence in key global markets such as APAC, Japan, Europe, and the US through strategic partnerships. job_description: About Agoda At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world. Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide. No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If youâ€™re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us. THIS ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED) Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work) Get to Know our Team: As part of the Supply Analytics, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day-to-day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agodaâ€™s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business. The Opportunity: As a Business Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Team members within Agoda. In this Role, youâ€™ll get to : Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the â€˜right questionsâ€™, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output) Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders. Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business. Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply. Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence. Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations What youâ€™ll Need to Succeed : At least 2-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably) Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R) Bachelorâ€™s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance). A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge (such as hypothesis testing, regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite. Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business A hackerâ€™s mindset â€“ the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping. Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills. Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement. Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment. Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources. Itâ€™s Great if you Have: MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance). Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience. Asian market experience. location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: We are seeking a Junior HR Analyst who supports core HR functions by executing and optimizing processes across payroll, benefits, HR systems, reporting, and analytics. This role ensures compliance, maintains data accuracy, and drives operational efficiency while enabling informed decision-making through robust analysis and reporting. ACCOUNTABILITIES HRIS Data Management & Payroll Operation Ensure accurate HRIS data setup, including department, division, pay group, and employee status. Support processing payroll, including update new hire/termination, validate time and attendance, uploading payroll files. Reconcile and maintain payroll records to ensure accuracy, compliance, and timely resolution of discrepancies. Review benefits enrollments and payroll deductions escalate issues as needed. Support Year End and Quarterly Payroll and Benefit Deduction reconciliation processes Provide system access setup and HRIS guidance for new hires and leavers, ensuring proper onboarding and offboarding documentation. Leave Administration & State Program Support Track and update employee leave records, including state disability leave. Make sure all forms are complete, accurate, and submitted on time for HRBP review. Support HRBPs in handling leave communications and unemployment insurance claims, ensuring complete and accurate submissions. Compliance & Reporting Maintain the state-by-state repository of required Labor law notices and ensure timely updates to leaders and staff for posting compliance. Check onboarding and benefits documents to make sure they are correct and follow company and legal rules. Prepare monthly, yearly, and other HR reports as needed. Support reporting requirements for external agencies, including OEWS submissions to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics. Help the HR team by reviewing data on staff turnover and other key trends. Onboarding & Orientation Support Ensure HRIS is configured to support onboarding workflows Track onboarding/offboarding programs and ensure new hires complete required tasks. Coordinate onboarding materials and communication, acting as the main contact for new hires during their onboarding period. Human Resources Prepare and complete verification of employment letters and respond to vendor requests. Identify and support the implementation of continuous improvement initiatives in HR processes and reporting. Support key HR programs, including compensation reviews, open enrollment, and compliance training. Manage and communicate the annual HR calendar of activities, initiatives, and events. Support merit increase and bonus processes; prepare and distribute salary increase and bonus letters. Contribute to Pay Equity, Compensation & Benefits benchmarking, Salary Leveling, and External Market Analysis through data-driven insights. Track and process HR invoices and payments. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelorâ€™s Degree required; preferred majors include Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field 1-3 years HR experience in payroll processing or HR data analyst capacity English proficiency at advanced or intermediate level. Demonstrated success in data analytics and reporting using tools such as Excel, Tableau, Power BI. Proven ability to work independently, drive process improvement and support change management initiatives. U.S. payroll processing experience preferred Marketing and/or corporate communications experience preferred BENEFITS Hybrid working model: enjoy the flexibility of working both remotely and in-office Full salary during probation: because we value your contribution and effort Social/ Health/ Unemployment Insurance on full salary Various allowances: provided with allowance for meals, birthday, marriage, funeral, business trip and newborn. Attractive bonuses: 13th Month salary and Performance bonus Annual Salary review: ensuring your income reflects your contributions Complementary health insurance package Annual Health checkup: keeping your health on track with yearly health check-up Engaging company activities: employees bonding with team building, birthday celebrations and other holiday festivities Complimentary snacks.

Proven track record with Microsoft Data & AI solutions, specifically Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Copilot, and Azure OpenAI. Strong presentation and communication skills. Ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Experience with BI tools and Data Warehousing concepts. Proficiency in developing AI application strategies. Languages: Fluent in Vietnamese and English. What we offer: Working time: Mond-Fri, flexible working time Attractive salary with 100% salary during probation Full-pay insurance, Compliance fully to Vietnam Labor code Attractive Bonus, & Allowances for mobile, transportation, parking Opportunities to work with global colleagues from different cultures Premium Healthcare insurance for employee and family (spouse/children) Annual Health check-up Birthday paid day-off & Birthday gift Recognition program, Referral program Working device provided by company Other activities: annual company trip, year-end dinner, exciting engagement events, Coaching opportunities, etc. Annual Salary Review & Promotion Donâ€™t forget to include your CV with photo and cover letter. job_description: WEALLNET is a brand new experience agency that exists to reimagine what an experience can be. location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: SERVICE BUSINESS CONTROLLER, KSEA Shape the future of cities. Join our flow. Welcome to KONE! We are a diverse team of over 60,000 employees, enabling safe, sustainable, and effortless people flow for billions of city dwellers every day. Innovating together across everything we do, we show the way for the good of our planet and its people. Here, you are welcomed as you are, your courage is celebrated, and your impact rewarded. Grounded by our strong roots stretching back over a century, our exciting journey continues â€“ join us and letâ€™s shape the future of cities together! Why this role? KONE is seeking a skilled and experienced Service Business Controller, KSEA to oversee the day-to-day business controlling activities of the Unit. This role ensures that KONEâ€™s operations comply with the KONE Financial Control Model (FCM) and that all financial impacts are measured and reported in line with KONE accounting standards and reporting guidelines. The Business Controller also supports the development of local financial policies and ensures adherence to both local and global policies. What will you be doing? Manage and support all BU revenue and expense-reporting, ensuring control, accuracy, predictability and timely delivery of figures, analysis and comments. Ensure all local, regional and corporate reporting for BU is completed accurately and on time as directed. Support BU in pursuit financial targets through in-depth analysis and sharing of financial knowledge. Coordinate and manage allocations/cost sharing between BUs within or across markets, ensuring compliance with laws, policies, and best practices. Support the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual accounts. Collaborate with BU managers to communicate, discuss, and challenge financial impacts through analysis. Prepare and present financial input and commentary at BU/Brand-related meetings as required. Attend regional BU finance meetings when requested and manage financial information requests from Regional/Corporate BU organizations. Handle ad hoc tasks related to the Business Finance function. Are you the one? Education: Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Finance or a related field. Experience: Minimum 5 years of professional experience, including 2â€“3 years in a similar role within a manufacturing or engineering company. Experience with global reporting is an advantage. Strong background in budgeting, forecasting, and planning processes, including variance analysis. Supervisory or leadership experience (depending on role level). Skills: Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently. Strong multitasking capability and ability to perform under pressure. Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP, Hyperion, or similar). Strong English communication skills (written and spoken). Exceptional collaboration, coordination, and networking abilities. Strong project and change management skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of each individual. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life. Read more on www.kone.com/careers

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Trusting Social is an AI Fintech pioneer that's revolutionizing credit access in emerging markets. Our mission is "Advancing AI to Meet the Financial Needs of Everyday Consumers with Empathy." We've assessed over 1 billion consumers across four countries, and we're on a mission to provide 100 million credit lines using the power of AI and Big Data. Are you a dedicated and curious Senior Data Analyst ready to dive deep into data and drive impactful business decisions? We're looking for a proactive individual to join our dynamic team in Vietnam. If you're passionate about uncovering insights, solving complex problems, and contributing directly to operational excellence and product development in a company with a strong social mission, this role is for you! How You'll Make An Impact As a Senior Data Analyst at Trusting Social, you'll be at the core of our data-driven decision-making process. You'll analyze and interpret complex datasets to provide actionable insights that directly influence our strategic direction, product enhancements, and operational efficiency. Your work will not only improve our internal processes but also contribute directly to democratizing credit access for millions in emerging markets. What You'll Do Develop & Maintain Analytics Tools: Assist in the creation and upkeep of essential reports, dashboards, and analytical tools that empower sound business decisions. Conduct In-Depth Analysis: Perform thorough data analyses focused on practical problems that drive significant business improvements. Innovate Infrastructure: Support the maintenance and innovation of our analyst infrastructure, including code bases and business intelligence tools. Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with various departments to enhance workflows and boost overall organizational efficiency. Strengthen Our Team: Participate in talent acquisition and management efforts to help build and strengthen our analytics capabilities. What We're Looking For We need a proactive, insightful, and technically skilled Senior Data Analyst who can turn data into action: Insight Generation: You're exceptional at asking the right questions that lead to actionable business insights. Analytical Prowess: Strong skills in conducting thorough analyses, whether through data analysis, market research, or effective cross-team communication. Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in SQL and Python for data querying and manipulation. Critical Thinking: An aptitude for critically evaluating data outcomes, uncovering key insights, and challenging assumptions. Tech Adaptability: A keen interest and proven ability to leverage new technologies to enhance work quality and productivity. Industry Experience: A proven track record in banking, fintech, or retail business intelligence teams is highly advantageous. What We Offer Join our vibrant team and enjoy: Competitive compensation, including 13th-month salary and performance bonuses. Comprehensive health care for you and your dependents. Generous leave policies and flexible work hours. Convenient District 1 office location (next to a future metro station). Onsite lunch with multiple options. Grab for work allowance and fully equipped workstations. Fun team-building activities, sponsored sports clubs, and Thursday happy hours. Unlimited free coffee, tea, snacks, and fruit. A chance to make a profound social impact by democratizing credit access in emerging markets. At Trusting Social, we live by ownership, integrity, and agility in execution. We believe in doing what's right, what's best, and what's innovative. If you're smart, driven, and want to make a difference in the world with the most advanced and fascinating technology, we invite you to be part of our rockstar team! For more information about us, please visit our website: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=inAEDGvOcL8&t=29s

job_title: Professor of Logistics and Business Analytics  (Assistant (tenure track) / Associate Professor)
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: We are seeking for KÃ¼hne Logistics University (KLU), one of Germanyâ€™s top research-oriented private business schools and accredited by AACSB, is looking for an Assistant/Associate Professor in Logistics and Business Analytics for their new campus in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. The position is a full-time appointment to be filled at the earliest possible date. Founded in 2010, KÃ¼hne Logistics University (KLU) is a private, internationally accredited, and highly ranked business school in Hamburg, Germany, specializing in logistics and supply chain management. Following the successful launch of our Asia campus in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, in fall 2025, we are now hiring our first professors that support our research and teaching activities in Vietnam. In so doing, we follow our mission to contribute to local capacity building and knowledge transfer in the field of logistics, operations and supply chain management. Our programs are designed to prepare leaders for the supply chain challenges of a global business landscape. KLU Saigon represents KÃ¼hne Logistics Universityâ€™s pioneering step into Asia, establishing a new campus in Vietnamâ€™s economic hub. Since its launch, KLU Saigon has built bridges between research excellence and regional impact through initiatives such as the Green Economy Forum & Exhibition with EuroCham, the Humanitarian Logistics Hackathon, and multiple partnerships with universities and industries across Southeast Asia. Joining KLU Saigon means contributing to a new academic footprint that connects education, research, and practice while shaping the next generation of leaders in logistics, operations, and sustainability. KLU is a state-recognized university with the right to grant PhDs. With its AACSB accreditation, it ranks among the top 5% of business schools and management universities worldwide, with a dedicated focus on logistics, operations, and supply chain management. Your Responsibilities The professor will excel by conducting original and impactful research in their chosen area. As such, we expect from candidates not only commitment to publish their research in top-tier journals (see here for the KLU Journal List), but also a willingness to create scientific and societal impact with that research. Teaching will cover KLU-Saigonâ€™s courses in the areas of logistics and business analytics, including the use of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in operations and digitalization of supply chains. Like other faculty, the professor will be expected to participate in industry and university service activities. An interest in applying for third-party funding is also expected in the role of Research Director for KLU Saigonâ€™s planned research center. Your Qualifications Applicants need to have completed a PhD in operations management, logistics, operations research, industrial engineering, economics, or a related discipline. We are looking for a candidate with evidence of research excellence and the ability to publish in top-tier journals to enrich and expand the diverse research portfolio of our faculty. At KLU, we are dedicated to nurturing a collaborative and interdisciplinary academic culture. Applicants should have developed some data science expertise by applying advanced analytics, statistical methods, and/or machine learning techniques to extract valuable insights and knowledge from data within the domain of operations. In teaching, we seek a candidate with a strong ability and interest to translate research insights into engaging and interactive lectures. Candidates need to be fluent in English as all courses at KLU are taught in English. Vietnamese is a big advantage, while not an absolute requirement. Candidates familiar with and experience of working in the South-East Asia region will be preferred. We particularly encourage candidates who are interested in entrepreneurially co-shaping KLUâ€™s Saigon Campus, a key element in KLUâ€™s internationalization strategy, to apply. We offer KLU is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a culturally diverse, inclusive, and pluralistic intellectual community. With all current and upcoming faculty openings we look to further increase our diversity and inclusiveness. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to gender, ethnicity, nationality, family status or physical or mental disabilities. At KLU, we value the compatibility of family and career KLU will offer an internationally competitive salary, which will be commensurate with experience, a very generous annual research budget and administrative support. See information about our tenure and promotion process here. The teaching load is attractive, with 150-200 teaching hours per year as the nominal load (1 teaching hour is equivalent to 45 minutes), and may include teaching at the undergraduate, master as well as executive education level. Located in KLU Saigon Campus, the professor will have close connections with faculty in KLU Hamburg and participate in faculty activities such as research seminars and PhD supervision as well as other appropriate events in Hamburg. Contact A complete application will include a CV, letter of intent, publication list, work samples (up to three working papers), names of three references, teaching portfolio (including details on teaching experience and student feedback), and research statement (including a description of research and publication projects in progress). Please submit this in one pdf. to klu-jobs@m.personio.de Please note that by submitting your application, you simultaneously give your consent to the electronic processing of your personal data until the application process is completed. Applications are open now and shall be submitted by 15th February 2026. Reviews will start thereafter. A campus visit is part of the final selection procedure. For inquiries regarding the position, please contact our Dean of Research, Professor Marianne Jahre, eMail: marianne.jahre@klu.org About Us KÃ¼hne Logistics Universityâ€“Wissenschaftliche Hochschule fÃ¼r Logistik und UnternehmensfÃ¼hrung is a private university founded in 2010 and located in Hamburg's HafenCity. KLU is a state-recognized university with the right to grant PhDs. With its AACSB accreditation, it ranks among the top 5% of business schools and management universities worldwide, with a dedicated focus on logistics, operations, and supply chain management. Following an internationalization strategy, we are now opening a campus in Vietnam and plan for two further campuses in Africa and the Americas. We instill KLU's signature operations mindset in all our students, drawing on the strengths and key characteristics of logistics, including resilience, data-driven and action-oriented decision-making. As a boutique university, KLU offers its students and doctoral candidates a high degree of specialization and excellent study conditions. Further education programs for specialists and managers are offered in the form of seminars and summer schools by KLU Executive Education.

job_title: Head of Business Development & Customer Engagement
location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Business Development & Customer Engagement Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam Are you passionate about developing new consumer-centric business channels in obesity and diabetes, improving customer experience and reach with omnichannel strategies, shaping high-impact commercial strategies based on data-driven insights, and optimizing our investments? If yes, we invite you to join Novo Nordisk as our new Head of Business Development & Customer Engagement. Read on and apply today! Your new role Novo Nordisk Vietnam is entering an exciting era within Obesity in Diabetes, and as Head of Business Development & Customer Engagement, you will play a key role in shaping the market for new launches and existing brands. Your taks wil include: Digital Health, Partnerships, Business Development and Strategy: Work closely across cross-functional teams to identify, pilot, and integrate digital health and closed-loop partnerships to enhance patient journeys, particularly in obesity and diabetes. Identify and develop new business opportunities, crafting and assessing go-to-market strategies for success. Use ROI analysis and market insights to guide smart and data-driven investment decisions. Champion and facilitate comprehensive cross-functional strategic planning processes from strategy to execution. Work in close collaboration with Marketing, Commercial, Medical, and Business Intelligence teams to ensure strategic alignment across the organization. Customer Engagement Transformation: Lead transformative initiatives to advance customer engagement, utilizing data-driven insights and advanced CRM tools. Expand and optimize omnichannel customer engagement (OCE) capabilities across Vietnam and target therapy areas, delivering consistent and high-impact experiences. Navigate Novo Nordisk into consumer-driven therapy areas, like obesity, working together across functions and partners on end-to-end activation campaigns, ensuring elevated engagement and measurable outcomes. Omnichannel Experience & Innovation : Championing the development and execution of robust digital marketing strategies that drive brand growth and awareness. Design, implement, and continually refine omnichannel customer experiencesâ€”including digital, remote, and in-person touchpointsâ€”to optimize engagement throughout the customer journey using Novo Nordisk or 3rd party-channels. Conduct deep analysis of target consumer and patient segments, leveraging insights around demographics, behaviors, needs, and digital readiness to inform personalized strategies. Forecasting & Commercial Excellence: Drive accurate forecasting and market potential assessments, leveraging existing data sources and integrating feedback loops to continuously improve commercial outcomes. Collaborate cross-functionally with Marketing, Commercial, Market Access, Finance & Operations teams to ensure unified commercial strategies, seamless pricing and tender processes, and robust management of key documentation. Insight-Driven Decision Support: Deliver actionable insights to support product launches, brand initiatives, planning, and company investments through advanced market analysis and business case development. Create and manage interactive dashboards and market mapping tools, providing real-time data to support strategic decision-making across the business. Sales Force Effectiveness & Incentives: Oversee the design and monitoring of sales incentives, driving segmentation and commercial effectiveness projects that inspire high performance and motivation among field teams. Enhance sales force effectiveness by spearheading segmentation, building capabilities, and leading change management initiatives. Leverage data-driven insights to ensure effective and optimized deployment of frontline across Vietnam to support strategic goals Your new department This role reports directly to the General Manager and is based in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. The Business Development & Customer Engagement department is a dynamic and collaborative team focused on driving business growth and fostering customer relationships. The atmosphere is fast-paced and engaging, with a strong emphasis on innovation, strategic thinking, and teamwork. Together, we aim to make a meaningful impact on the healthcare industry and the lives of patients worldwide. Your Skills & Qualifications Weâ€™re looking for a Head of Business Development & Customer Engagement, who will appreciate working in a high-paced, dynamic environment. You will bring with you: Masterâ€™s or university degree in Business Administration, Economics, Management, Marketing, or a related discipline. Experience as a people manager with a track record in team leadership, motivation, and developing people. Minimum 8â€“10 years of commercial management experience, ideally within a multinational company. Experience in pharmaceutical or life sciences is required with relevant exposure to multiple industries as an advantage. Demonstrated leadership in business development, commercial excellence, digital marketing, or customer engagement, preferably within life sciences or pharma sectors. Advanced commercial acumen and firsthand expertise in omnichannel engagement, including both digital and field-based CRM platforms such as Viva Engage or Sales Force. Experience in consumer activation campaigns and engagement through data-driven, analytics-informed strategies. In-depth knowledge of sales force effectiveness, capability building, project management, and change management. Excellent communication, interpersonal, and collaboration skills, with a demonstrated ability to thrive in cross-functional, international teams. Working at Novo Nordisk Every day we seek the solutions that defeat serious chronic diseases. To do this, we approach our work with an unconventional spirit, a rare determination and a constant curiosity. For over 100 years this unordinary mindset has seen us build a company unlike any other. One where a collective passion for our purpose, mutual respect and a willingness to go beyond what we know delivers extraordinary results. Deadline 4 January 2026. Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. Novo Nordisk is currently in the process of adjusting job titles globally. Please note that the job title listed in this advertisement may be subject to change. More detailed information will be provided during the recruitment process. Novo Nordisk is not your typical healthcare company. In a modern world of quick fixes, we focus on solutions to defeat serious chronic diseases and promote long-term health. Our unordinary mindset is at the heart of everything we do. We seek out new ideas and put people first as we push the boundaries of science, make healthcare more accessible, and treat, prevent, and even cure diseases that affect millions of lives. Because it takes an unordinary approach to drive real, lasting change in health.

location: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_description: Senior FP&A â€“ Reporting & Consolidation Location: Ho Chi Minh City Department: FP&A About Buymed Buymed (thuocsi.vn) is the largest B2B e-commerce platform for healthcare in Vietnam, now expanding across Southeast Asia. We enable over 35,000 pharmacies, clinics, and hospitals to access genuine medical products more efficiently through technology and supply chain innovation. Note: Our recruitment team will contact you via the email listed in your CV. Please ensure it is up to date and checked regularly. ----- About the Role The Senior FP&A plays a critical role in shaping how financial performance is measured, understood, and acted on across all Buymed entities. This role sits at the center of Group reporting, planning, and business insights, ensuring leadership has the right information to make high-stakes decisions in a rapidly evolving business. Key Responsibilities 1. Group Reporting & Consolidation Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual Group consolidated financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow, KPI dashboards). Perform intercompany reconciliation , ensuring full alignment with VAS/IFRS. Coordinate across Accounting, Finance, and BI teams in all subsidiaries to maintain consistency and accuracy of financial data. Conduct variance analysis (Actual vs Budget vs Forecast) and prepare explanations for management and Board reviews. 2. Financial Planning & Forecasting Support the preparation of the Group annual budget and rolling forecasts (Revenue, Opex, EBITDA, Cash Flow). Build and enhance financial models , including scenario planning and sensitivity analysis. Track performance metrics across multiple business units 3. Reporting & Process Improvement Identify trends, risks, and opportunities in revenue, cost structure, working capital, and profitability . Partner with BI to enhance Power BI dashboards , automate reporting, and improve data visibility. Support external audits, internal audits, and financial due diligence when required. Key Requirements 1. Qualifications Bachelorâ€™s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Audit . 4â€“6 years of experience in FP&A, Financial Reporting, or Consolidation. Background in Big4 audit , FMCG, e-commerce, or multi-entity group reporting is highly preferred. Strong proficiency in Excel and Power BI ; experience with SQL, SAP/ERP , or consolidation tools (Hyperion, Lucanet, etc.) is a plus. Solid understanding of VAS, IFRS, intercompany elimination, and consolidation logic . Good command of English for reporting and stakeholder communication at Group level. Mindset & Culture Fit At Buymed, we value outcomes over intentions. We move fast, stay practical, and focus on the quality of execution. We expect each member to take responsibility for their work, stay curious, and uphold accuracy as a non-negotiable standard. Visit: https://workexpectations.buymed.com/

job_description: THE COMPANY Oxalis Adventure is Asiaâ€™s premier adventure tour operator, providing unparalleled expeditions into the worldâ€™s largest caves and most remote jungles. THE ROLE: WHY THIS MATTERS The Assistant to the CEO is not a desk-bound administrative role; it is a high-impact position designed for a strategic thinker who isn't afraid to get their boots muddy. Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business. Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply. Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence. Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations What youâ€™ll Need to Succeed : At least 2-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably) Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R) Bachelorâ€™s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance). Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite. Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business A hackerâ€™s mindset â€“ the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping. Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills. Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement. Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment. Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources. Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience. Asian market experience.
